Summary: Lulu Hypermarkets in Saudi Arabia have introduced a "Taste of Sri Lanka" promotion at their branches in the Western Region of KSA. The inaugural event took place at the Jeddah Main Branch in Amir Fawaz under the patronage of Actin. This initiative aims to showcase Sri Lankan products to customers in the region.

Title: The first Sri Lankan appointed as the 12th Director General of Colombo Plan Staff College (CPSC) in Manila
Summary: Sri Lankan Prof. Ganemulle Lekamalage Dharmasri Wickramas has made history by becoming the first Sri Lankan appointed as the 12th Director General of the Colombo Plan Staff College (CPSC) in Manila. The CPSC serves as the training arm of the Colombo Plan, with its headquarters based in Sri Lanka.

Title: Lulu Hypermarkets – Saudi Arabia host “Sri Lanka product promotion Week”
Summary: Lulu Hypermarkets in Saudi Arabia are hosting a "Sri Lanka Product Promotion Week" from September 8 to 14, 2021. The event showcases a variety of Sri Lankan products to both Saudi nationals and expatriates, offering a unique opportunity to experience the country's offerings.

Title: Embassy of Sri Lanka in Moscow receives cultural items for exhibiting
Summary: The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Moscow received cultural items for exhibition from State Minister of Rattan, Brass, Pottery, Furniture, and Rural Industrial Promotion Prasanna Ranaweera as per their request. The items include dancing costumes and traditional artifacts.

Title: Consul General Promotes Sri Lanka Tourism at the Diplomatic Summer Celebrations in Frankfurt am Main
Summary: Consul General of Sri Lanka to Frankfurt, Madurika Joseph Weninger, served as the Chief Guest at the annual Diplomatic Council Summer Celebrations on August 26, 2021. The event took place at the prestigious Villa Bonn in Frankfurt am Main, where she promoted Sri Lanka tourism.

Title: High Commissioner Amarasekara to accelerate Sri Lanka –Zimbabwe relations
Summary: High Commissioner of Sri Lanka to South Africa S. Amarasekara recently met with Ambassador of Zimbabwe to South Africa David Hamadziripi at the Zimbabwean Embassy in Pretoria to strengthen Sri Lanka-Zimbabwe relations. The visit aimed to enhance cooperation and foster closer ties between the two countries.

Title: Sinopharm to provide additional vaccine and considers establishing a vaccine plant in Sri Lanka
Summary: Sinopharm plans to provide additional vaccines and is considering establishing a vaccine plant in Sri Lanka. The Ambassador of Sri Lanka to China met with Sinopharm Group's Chairman, Liu Jingzhen, and senior management on September 7, 2021, handing over a personal letter from President Gotabay.

Title: Sri Lankan Envoy in Pretoria hunts for business opportunities in Zambia
Summary: Sri Lankan High Commissioner to South Africa, S. Amarasekara, visited Zambia to explore business opportunities for Sri Lankan companies. Zambia is one of the nine countries targeted for potential partnerships. The envoy aims to strengthen economic ties between the two nations.

Title: Research Symposium 2021 organised by the Sri Lanka High Commission in London and the Association of Professional Sri Lankans in the UK
Summary: The 'SLHC and APSL Research Symposium 2021' was organized by the Sri Lanka High Commission in London and the Association of Professional Sri Lankans in the UK. The virtual event took place on September 1, 2021, with wide representation.

Title: 70th Anniversary “Treaty of Peace with Japan” was remembered and broadcast live at the Sri Lanka Mission in Tokyo
Summary: The 70th anniversary of the "Treaty of Peace with Japan" was commemorated at the Sri Lanka Mission in Tokyo, with a limited Japanese VIP delegation present. The event honored the speech delivered by then Finance Minister J.R. Jayawardene on September 6, 1951 in San Francisco.

Title: Ambassador of Sri Lanka to Thailand meets Prime Minister and Minister of Defense of the Kingdom Thailand
Summary: The Ambassador of Sri Lanka to Thailand, C.A. Chaminda I. Colonne, met with the Prime Minister and Minister of Defense of Thailand during a courtesy visit. Colonne also serves as the Permanent Representative of Sri Lanka to the UNESCAP.

Title: Sri Lanka Investment Seminar in Vienna
Summary: The Embassy and Permanent Mission of Sri Lanka in Vienna, in partnership with the Vienna Chamber of Commerce (WKO), hosted a hybrid webinar to encourage Austrian investments in Sri Lanka. The seminar aimed to promote business opportunities and strengthen economic ties between the two countries. This initiative signifies a collaborative effort to boost investment prospects and foster bilateral relations.

Title: Sri Lanka Embassy in Germany focuses on supporting Agri Exporters  Webinar on “The Art of Approaching a Buyer in Agri Products Sector”
Summary: The Sri Lanka Embassy in Germany organized a webinar titled "The Art of Approaching a Buyer in Agri Products Sector" to support Sri Lankan agri exporters in connecting with EU buyers. The webinar took place on August 31, 2021, aiming to educate exporters on effective strategies for engaging with the European market.

Title: Two Sri Lankan military officers receives Masters Degree scholarships for the first time at Indonesia Defence University
Summary: Two Sri Lankan Army Officers, Lieutenant Colonel Janaka Ranaweera and Lieutenant Colonel Kosala Wijekoon, have been awarded scholarships to pursue a Master's degree in Defence Diplomacy (International) at the Indonesia Defence University, marking the first time Sri Lankan military officers have received this opportunity. This initiative aims to enhance their knowledge and skills in defense diplomacy.

Title: Ambassador designate of Sri Lanka to Iran  pays courtesy call on the  Minister of Foreign Affairs of Iran
Summary: Sri Lanka's Ambassador designate to Iran, G.M.V. Wishwanath Aponsu, visited Iran's new Minister of Foreign Affairs, Dr. Hossein Amir-Abdollahian, on September 1st. The meeting was a courtesy call between the two diplomats.

Title: Nikini Poya – 2021 Celebrations at Sri Lanka Embassy to Lebanon & Syria
Summary: The Embassy of Sri Lanka to Lebanon & Syria celebrated Nikini Poya on August 29, 2021, as part of their Public Diplomacy Community Outreach Program. The event included a Dhamma discourse titled “Life and Buddhi” to commemorate the occasion.

Title: High Commissioner of Sri Lanka to Kenya Kananathan visits Hela Clothing factory in Kenya
Summary: High Commissioner of Sri Lanka to Kenya, Velupillai Kananathan, visited the Hela Clothing factory in Nairobi on August 31, 2021, as part of the economic diplomacy programme. The purpose of the visit was to strengthen bilateral ties and explore opportunities for collaboration.

Title: Sri Lanka Embassy in Japan conducts successful Mobile Consular Service and Community Event in Kyoto, Japan
Summary: The Sri Lanka Embassy in Japan successfully conducted a Mobile Consular Service and Community Event in Kyoto, Japan, approximately 600 km away from Tokyo on Saturday, 28 August 2021. This initiative aimed to engage with the community and provide consular services to Sri Lankan citizens living in Kyoto.

Title: International Military-Technical Forum “Army-2021” and International Army Games-2021 in Russia
Summary: A delegation from the Ministry of Defence of Sri Lanka, led by Defence Secretary Gen. (Rtd.) Kamal Gunaratne, visited Moscow, Russia from August 20 to 26 to participate in the International Military-Technical Forum “Army-2021” and International Army Games-2021.

Title: Lectures on Sri Lankan Health System for Heads of Moscow Hospitals
Summary: Heads of Moscow hospitals received lectures on Sri Lanka's healthcare system on August 7 and 21, 2021, as part of the collaboration between the healthcare sectors of Sri Lanka and Russia. The lectures aimed to enhance understanding and cooperation between the two countries' healthcare systems.

Title: Defence Secretary Gen. (Rtd.) Kamal Gunaratne meets Secretary of the Security Council of the Russian Federation Nikolay Patrushev
Summary: Defence Secretary Gen. (Rtd.) Kamal Gunaratne met with Secretary of the Security Council of the Russian Federation Nikolay Patrushev during his official visit to Russia, invited by Minister of Defence Sergei Shoigu. The meeting was part of a delegation headed by Gen. Gunaratne.

Title: Sri Lankan Defence Delegation meet the Deputy Minister of Defence of Russian Federation Colonel General Alexander Fomin
Summary: A Sri Lankan Defence Delegation, led by Defence Secretary Gen. (Rtd.) Kamal Gunaratne, met with the Deputy Minister of Defence of the Russian Federation, Colonel General Alexander Fomin, during their visit to the International Military-Technical Forum "Army-2021" and International Army Games-2021. The meeting aimed to strengthen defense cooperation between the two countries.

Title: High Commissioner-designate of Sri Lanka to India Milinda Moragoda assumes duties in New Delhi
Summary: Milinda Moragoda, the new High Commissioner-designate of Sri Lanka to India, assumed duties at a ceremony in New Delhi on August 30, 2021. He was appointed with cabinet rank and the event took place at the High Commission of Sri Lanka.

Title: Mahachulalongkorn Rajavidyalaya University (MCU) TV presents the very first live telecast on Esala Perahera Randoli, the festival of Sacred Tooth Relic in Thailand
Summary: Mahachulalongkorn Rajavidyalaya University (MCU) TV recently aired the first live telecast of the Esala Perahera Randoli festival in Thailand, showcasing the Sacred Tooth Relic. The event was presented in collaboration with the Embassy and Permanent Mission of Sri Lanka in Bangkok, Sri Dalada Maligawa, and Sri Lanka Tourism.

Title: A Conference to share information about, and opportunities in the Buddhist Education Sector in Sri Lanka with prospective institutions in Viet Nam
Summary: The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Viet Nam and the Export Development Board of Sri Lanka organized a virtual conference to share information about opportunities in the Buddhist Education Sector in Sri Lanka with prospective institutions in Viet Nam. The conference aimed to facilitate collaboration and exchange between the two countries in the field of Buddhist education.

Title: Ceylon Chamber of Commerce and the Maldives National Chamber of Commerce and Industry to finalise Memorandum of Understanding on bilateral trade and business
Summary: The Ceylon Chamber of Commerce and the Maldives National Chamber of Commerce and Industry are set to finalize a Memorandum of Understanding to enhance bilateral trade and business relations. Officials emphasized the opportunity presented by the Covid crisis to strengthen ties for mutual benefits between Sri Lanka and the Maldives during a meeting on August 26, 2021.

Title: Ambassador of Sri Lanka to Oman Ameer Ajwad presented Letter of Credence as the Non-resident Ambassador to the Republic of Yemen
Summary: Ambassador of Sri Lanka to Oman, Ameer Ajwad, presented his Letter of Credence to the President of Yemen, Abd Rabbuh Mansour Al Hadi, at the Presidential Palace in Riyadh. This signifies his appointment as the Non-resident Ambassador to Yemen.

Title: Sri Lanka Mission in South Africa team up with the Minara Chamber of Commerce in Durban
Summary: The High Commissioner of Sri Lanka, Sirisena Amarasekara, recently met with senior executives from the Minara Chamber of Commerce in South Africa and the National Chamber of Exporters in Sri Lanka to discuss collaboration. The meeting aimed to strengthen ties between the two chambers and explore opportunities for trade and cooperation.

Title: China Gifts 300,000 Doses of Covid-19 Vaccines to Sri Lanka Armed Forces;  A total of 3 million to Sri Lanka
Summary: China will gift 300,000 doses of Sinopharm vaccines to the Sri Lankan Armed Forces, with a total of 3 million doses planned for Sri Lanka. The Sri Lanka Embassy in Beijing is coordinating the vaccine donation with the Ministry of Defence in Sri Lanka.

Title: Ambassador of Sri Lanka to China Dr. Palitha Kohona Calls for Greater Cooperation between China and Members of the SCO at the Smart China Expo 2021 in Chongqing
Summary: Ambassador of Sri Lanka to China Dr. Palitha Kohona participated in the China-SCO Forum on the Digital Economy Industry at the Smart China Expo 2021 in Chongqing from August 23-25. During the forum, he emphasized the need for increased cooperation between China and SCO members.

Title: The Sri Lanka High Commission and Consulate General hold the first International Day of Remembrance and tribute to the victims of terrorism
Summary: The Sri Lanka High Commission in Ottawa and Consulate General in Toronto held a virtual event on August 21, 2021, commemorating the first International Day of Remembrance and tribute to victims of terrorism at 6:00 p.m. The event aimed to honor and remember those affected by terrorism.

Title: Staff of the Sri Lanka High Commission in Kenya donates  one month salary to the COVID-19 Fund
Summary: Staff of the Sri Lanka High Commission in Kenya have donated one month's salary to the COVID-19 Fund in response to the escalating situation in Sri Lanka. The donation reflects their support for the government's efforts, led by President Gotabaya Rajapaksa, to combat the pandemic in the country.

Title: Ambassador of Sri Lanka to Washington Aryasinha inaugurates US based Overseas Sri Lankan Academic and Research Collaboration Network’
Summary: Ambassador of Sri Lanka to Washington Aryasinha inaugurated the 'US-Sri Lanka Academic and Research Collaboration Network' (USLARCN) during a virtual meeting on 15 August 2021. The network was launched by the Embassy of Sri Lanka in Washington D.C. to foster academic and research collaborations between the two countries.

Title: Two tons of medical equipment donated by Sri Lankan community  in Australia sent to Sri Lanka
Summary: The Consulate General of Sri Lanka in Melbourne facilitated the donation of two tons of medical equipment by the Sri Lankan community in Australia. The equipment was sent in nine consignments via direct flights from Melbourne to Colombo by Sri Lankan Airlines between June 9 and August 7.

Title: Promoting “Destination Sri Lanka” in Jordan
Summary: The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Jordan hosted a meeting on 02 August to promote "Destination Sri Lanka" and encourage outbound tourism from Jordan. The event aimed to engage leading tour and travel companies in promoting travel to Sri Lanka.

Title: Showcasing the Island of Ingenuity to the Pearl of the Orient:  Exploring opportunities for mutually-beneficial engagements   in the ICT-BPM Sector
Summary: The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Manila is actively enhancing bilateral trade and investments with the Philippines, focusing on the ICT-BPM sector. They are working to strengthen ties and create mutually beneficial engagements between the two countries. This initiative aims to bridge the gap and foster collaboration in key sectors for economic growth and development.

Title: Sri Lanka High Commission in Kenya facilitates despatch of Syringes to Sri Lanka
Summary: The Sri Lanka High Commission in Kenya facilitated the dispatch of syringes to Sri Lanka to support the country's COVID-19 vaccination campaign led by President Gotabaya Rajapaksa. The consignment was arranged to aid the ongoing efforts in Sri Lanka.

Title: High Commissioner of Sri Lanka to South Africa discuss enhancing bilateral trade links with the Convener of the Progressive Business Forum of the African National Congress
Summary: High Commissioner of Sri Lanka to South Africa, Sirisena Amarasekara, met with Sipho Mbele, the Convener of the Progressive Business Forum of the African National Congress, on July 28, 2021, at the official residence to discuss enhancing bilateral trade links between the two countries. The meeting aimed to strengthen economic ties and promote trade relations.

Title: Cyprus expresses to enhance bilateral relations with Sri Lanka
Summary: The Consul General of Sri Lanka in Cyprus, M.H.M.N Bandara, met with the newly appointed President of the House of Representatives, Annita Demetriou, on August 5, 2021, to discuss enhancing bilateral relations. During the meeting, the Consul General expressed Cyprus's commitment to strengthening ties with Sri Lanka.

Title: Ambassador of Sri Lanka to the Kingdom of Thailand assures strengthening cooperation with the Asian Institute of Technology (AIT)
Summary: The Ambassador of Sri Lanka to Thailand and Permanent Representative to the UNESCAP, C.A. Chaminda I. Colonne, assured of strengthening cooperation with the Asian Institute of Technology during the Board of Trustees online meeting on August 5, 2021. Sri Lanka's commitment to collaboration was emphasized during this significant gathering.

Title: The Head of Mission and Force Commander of the UN Peacekeeping Mission in Lebanon praises Sri Lankan troops at UNIFIL for their outstanding professionalism
Summary: The Head of Mission and Force Commander of UNIFIL, Major General Stefano DEL COL, praised the professionalism of Sri Lankan troops at UNIFIL during a discussion with Sri Lanka’s Ambassador to Lebanon, Shani Calyaneratne Karunaratne. He thanked the Sri Lankan troops for their outstanding performance.

Title: Sri Lanka High Commission in Canberra celebrates Eid
Summary: The Sri Lanka High Commission in Canberra celebrated Eid-ul-Adha with the Sri Lankan Muslim community on July 31, 2021, at the High Commission premises. Eid is a sacred event celebrated annually by Muslims worldwide.

Title: Courtesy call on Deputy Prime Minister, Foreign and Defense Minister of the Republic of Lebanon Zeina Akar, by the Ambassador of Sri Lanka on 03 August, 2021
Summary: On August 3, 2021, Sri Lankan Ambassador Shani Calyaneratne Karunaratne paid a courtesy call on Deputy Prime Minister, Foreign, and Defense Minister of Lebanon, Zeina Akar at the Ministry.

Title: Facilitation of Trade through the Fujian-Sri Lanka Economic & Trade Cooperation online Matchmaking Conference in Fujian Province, China
Summary: The Consulate General of Sri Lanka in Guangzhou, in collaboration with the Department of Commerce of Fujian Province, organized the Fujian-Sri Lanka Economic & Trade Cooperation online Matchmaking Conference in Fujian Province, China. The event, with the participation of the Sri Lanka Export Development Board, aimed to facilitate trade between the two regions.

Title: Omani Investor delegation concludes productive visit to Sri Lanka with signing of MoU
Summary: An investor delegation from Omani Shumookh International LLC, the investment arm of Madayn, concluded a productive visit to Sri Lanka organized by the Sri Lanka Embassy in Oman. The visit resulted in the signing of a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between the two parties, strengthening bilateral investment ties.

Title: Sri Lankan universities to establish links with Istanbul University
Summary: Sri Lankan universities are set to establish links with Istanbul University as Ambassador M. Rizvi met with the Rector, Prof. Dr. Mahmut Ak, on July 28, 2021. They discussed ways to foster cooperation between the institutions during the meeting at the Office of the Rector.

Title: Director General of Chongqing Foreign Affairs Office Zhang Yongwu invites Sri Lanka to participate in the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation’s Forum on Digital Economy Industry
Summary: Director General Zhang Yongwu of Chongqing Foreign Affairs Office invited Sri Lanka to join the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation’s Forum on Digital Economy Industry. He met with Sri Lankan Ambassador Dr. Palitha Kohona on July 30, 2021, at the Embassy in China.

Title: Sri Lanka to exploit Trade, Investment and Tourism potentials in Black Sea Region of Turkey
Summary: Sri Lanka's Ambassador to Turkey, M. Rizvi Hassen, visited Turkey's Black Sea Region to identify opportunities for establishing relations and boosting trade, investment, and tourism links between the two countries. The visit aimed to explore the region's potential for collaboration in these key areas.

Title: Deputy High Commissioner of Sri Lanka to Chennai visits Brandix India Apparel City in India
Summary: Deputy High Commissioner of Sri Lanka to Chennai, Dr. D. Venkateshwaran, visited Brandix India Apparel City (BIAC) in Atchutapuram near Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh, at the invitation of Brandix Group CEO, Ash.

Title: Webinar hosted by Embassy of Sri Lanka in Germany on “Finding a Market for Agri Products in EU” concludes successfully
Summary: The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Germany successfully concluded a webinar on "Finding a Market for Agri Products in EU," focusing on Organic Markets. The event was organized in collaboration with the Import Promotion Desk of Germany and Export D.

Title: Webinar on “Sri Lanka as a Potential Alternative Manufacturing Hub” on 26 July 2021
Summary: A webinar titled "Sri Lanka as a Potential Alternative Manufacturing Hub" was organized by the Commercial Section of the Sri Lanka High Commission in Singapore in collaboration with the Singapore Manufacturing Federation on July 26, 2021. The event aimed to explore Sri Lanka's potential as a manufacturing hub and foster partnerships between the two countries.

Title: Commemorating the 5th Anniversary of the Establishment of Diplomatic Relations between Sri Lanka and Monaco
Summary: This year commemorates the 5th anniversary of the formal establishment of diplomatic relations between Sri Lanka and Monaco. In honor of this milestone, the Ambassador of Sri Lanka will be participating in special events to mark the occasion.

Title: Sports Minister Namal Rajapaksa meets with Secretary, Sri Lanka – Japan Parliamentarians’ Friendship League Yuko Obuchi
Summary: Sports Minister Namal Rajapaksa met with Secretary Yuko Obuchi of the Sri Lanka – Japan Parliamentarians’ Friendship League to discuss various matters concerning the two countries. The meeting aimed to strengthen bilateral relations and cooperation between Sri Lanka and Japan.

Title: Awarding ceremony for the teachers of online Sinhala Language course
Summary: The Embassy held a Certificates Awarding Ceremony for teachers of the Online Sinhala Language Course, conducted from October 2020 to February 2021 for Russian-speaking students. The event recognized the educators' dedication and contribution to the program.

Title: Ambassador of Sri Lanka to China Dr. Palitha Kohona hails China’s Successful Management of Covid-19, including by Relying on Traditional medicine
Summary: Ambassador of Sri Lanka to China Dr. Palitha Kohona praised China's effective handling of Covid-19, highlighting the use of traditional medicine. He made the remarks during a MoU signing event between Liaoning University of Chinese Traditional Medicine and Gampaha Wickramarachchi University of Indigenous Medicine in Shenyang, Liaoning Province.

Title: Embassy continues to strengthen the ties between Sri Lankan and Russian schools
Summary: The Sri Lankan Embassy in Moscow organized a virtual meeting between the Ministry of Education of Sri Lanka and Russian schools to strengthen ties. This initiative aims to enhance collaboration and educational opportunities between the two countries.

Title: Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa congratulates newly appointed Nepali Prime Minister Sher Bahadur Deuba
Summary: Sri Lankan Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa congratulated newly appointed Nepali Prime Minister Sher Bahadur Deuba, emphasizing the strong friendship between their countries. Rajapaksa described Sri Lanka and Nepal as 'true friends' who draw strength from their relationship.

Title: Esala – 2021 Celebrations at Sri Lanka Embassy in Lebanon and Syria
Summary: The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Lebanon and Syria celebrated Esala poya with a "Sath Budu Wandanawa" as part of their Community outreach program on July 25, 2021. The event was held at the Embassy premises and led by Rev. Menikdiwela, commemorating the occasion.

Title: Ambassador Majintha Jayesinghe presented Letters of Credence in Slovakia
Summary: Ambassador Majintha Jayesinghe presented the Letters of Credence to President Zuzana Čaputová of Slovakia at the Presidential Palace in Bratislava on July 7, 2021, accrediting as the Ambassador Extraordinaire.

Title: Appreciation of Migrant Workers for their performance for Sinhala and Tamil New Year and Poson  Bhakthi Gee singing  competitions
Summary: Sri Lankan Ambassador to Lebanon Shani Calyaneratne Karunaratne, along with embassy officials, organized Sinhala and Tamil New Year and Poson Bhakthi Gee singing competitions to appreciate the performance of migrant workers. This initiative was part of the Public Diplomacy and Embassy Outreach Community welfare program, aiming to recognize and celebrate the contributions of migrant workers.

Title: Ambassador Dr. Palitha Kohona Visits Wuhan University
Summary: Ambassador Dr. Palitha Kohona visited Wuhan University in Hubei Province on July 19, 2021, at the invitation of the Vice President of the University and the China Great Wall Industrial Corporation. The visit aimed to further explore collaboration opportunities.

Title: Sri Lankan Embassy in Doha, facilitates the donation of 85 Oxygen Cylinders to Sri Lanka
Summary: The Sri Lankan Embassy in Doha facilitated the donation of 85 oxygen cylinders to Sri Lanka to support the country's efforts in combating the COVID-19 pandemic. The cylinders were donated to the health sector to help address the urgent need for medical oxygen.

Title: Opening ceremony of the newly established Sri Lanka Buddhist Vihara in Hurdal, Norway
Summary: The Sri Lanka Buddhist Vihara in Hurdal, Norway was officially opened on July 3, 2021, by Ven. Marathugoda Manirathana Thero and Ven. Unapane Pema, the Chief incumbents.

Title: Embassy of Sri Lanka Launches Sri Lanka Online Platform, “Sri Lanka Platform” along with an Investment Promotion Seminar
Summary: The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Beijing partnered with Hairong Technology Co. Ltd to launch the Sri Lanka Online Platform and host an investment promotion seminar (SEIC 2021) on July 11, 2021. The event took place at the Embassy, aiming to showcase investment opportunities in Sri Lanka.

Title: High Commissioner of Sri Lanka to Kenya Kananathan and LOLC Chairman Ishara Nanayakkara unveils the first Lord Buddha statue in public place in Kenya
Summary: The High Commissioner of Sri Lanka to Kenya, Kananathan, and LOLC Chairman Ishara Nanayakkara unveiled the first Lord Buddha statue in a public place in Kenya at the Sri Lanka High Commission in Nairobi. This marks the first time a Buddha statue has been erected in a public location in Kenya.

Title: Japan Gifts 1.45 million Astra Zeneca Vaccines at the request of President and the work of Sri Lankan Mission in Japan
Summary: Japan has gifted 1.45 million doses of AstraZeneca vaccine to Sri Lanka through the COVAX Facility, as requested by the President and facilitated by the Sri Lankan Mission in Japan. This donation aims to support Sri Lanka in preventing the spread of COVID-19.

Title: Ambassador of Sri Lanka to France Prof. Kshanika Hirimburegama visited the Curie Institute, Paris
Summary: Ambassador of Sri Lanka to France Prof. Kshanika Hirimburegama visited the Curie Institute in Paris and met with Dr. Pierre Anhour, Director of the International Division, on July 8, 2021, at the renowned garden of Marie Curie.

Title: Sri Lankan Ambassador attends the Awarding Ceremony for Interaction with MFA
Summary: Sri Lankan Ambassador Prof. M.D. Lamawansa attended an Awarding Ceremony hosted by the Russian Association for International Cooperation's Secretary General Vladimi. The event aimed to enhance interaction between Sri Lanka and Russia in the field of international relations.

Title: Ambassador of Sri Lanka to China Dr. Palitha Kohona attends the opening of the China – South Asia Emergency Supplies Reserve in Chengdu
Summary: Ambassador of Sri Lanka to China Dr. Palitha Kohona attended the opening of the China-South Asia Emergency Supplies Reserve in Chengdu on July 9, 2021. The emergency reserve was established following a Zoom meeting. This initiative aims to enhance emergency response capabilities in the region.

Title: Sri Lanka – Oman National Chambers of Commerce sign MOU to boost Trade and Investment
Summary: The National Chamber of Commerce of Sri Lanka (NCCSL) and the Oman Chamber of Commerce and Industry (OCCI) signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) on July 7 to boost trade and investment between the two countries. This agreement aims to strengthen economic ties and facilitate business opportunities for Sri Lanka and Oman.

Title: Poverty Alleviation and Cooperative Development Center opened in Chongqing, China
Summary: The Poverty Alleviation and Cooperative Development Center was inaugurated at South West University in Chongqing, China, with the participation of Sri Lankan Ambassador to China, Dr. Palitha Kohona. The ceremony marked the official opening of the center aimed at addressing poverty and fostering cooperative development initiatives.

Title: Donation  of 100,000 face masks to Sri Lanka and discussions on trade and cultural cooperation during the photo ceremony
Summary: During a photo ceremony, the Consulate General of Sri Lanka in Guangzhou received a donation of 100,000 face masks from Hongda Xingye Co., Ltd. The masks will be donated to Buddhist temples and organizations in Sri Lanka, alongside discussions on trade and cultural cooperation.

Title: Investment loans for Green Projects discussed with European Investment Bank (EIB)
Summary: The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Brussels arranged a virtual meeting on July 7, 2021, between officials from the European Investment Bank (EIB) and Sri Lankan representatives to discuss investment loans for Green Projects. The discussion aimed to explore potential collaborations in sustainable initiatives.

Title: Donation of Medical Equipment to Sri Lanka
Summary: The non-profit organization Hospital Without Borders (HSF/ZZG) in Belgium donated Oxygen Concentrators to Sri Lanka to assist in combating the COVID-19 crisis. The donation aims to support Sri Lanka in addressing the challenges posed by the pandemic.

Title: Ambassador of Sri Lanka to France meets with the President of the France – Sri Lanka Friendship Group of the French National Assembly
Summary: The Ambassador of Sri Lanka to France, Prof. Kshanika Hirimburegama, met with the President of the France-Sri Lanka Friendship Group of the French National Assembly, a Member of Parliament, for discussions.

Title: Ambassador of Sri Lanka to Poland Dhammika Kumari Semasinghe presented Letters of Credence in Poland
Summary: Ambassador of Sri Lanka to Poland, Dhammika Kumari Semasinghe, presented the Letters of Credence to the President of the Republic of Poland, Andrzej Duda, at the Belvedere Palace in Warsaw on July 6, 2021. This formal presentation marked the official beginning of her diplomatic duties in Poland.

Title: UNESCAP and Sri Lankan Authorities held National consultation workshop on Sustainable Freight Transport strategy in Sri Lanka
Summary: The United Nations Economic and Social Commission for Asia and the Pacific (UNESCAP) and Sri Lankan authorities conducted a national consultation workshop on a sustainable freight transport strategy in Sri Lanka. The workshop was held virtually to discuss and develop strategies for sustainable freight transport in the country.

Title: Ambassador of India to Norway Dr. B. Bala Bhaskar paid a visit to the Embassy of Sri Lanka in Norway
Summary: Ambassador of India to Norway Dr. B. Bala Bhaskar visited the Embassy of Sri Lanka in Oslo on 6 July, 2021, where he met with Ambassador of Sri Lanka to Norway Godfrey Cooray. Ambassador Cooray warmly welcomed Ambassador Bhaskar during the visit.

Title: The first One-Day Consular Mobile Service by the Consulate General of Sri Lanka, Milan, Italy
Summary: The Consulate General of Sri Lanka in Milan, Italy held its first One-Day Consular Mobile Service in Genoa, Northern Italy on June 26, 2021. The program aimed to offer additional assistance to Sri Lankan citizens in the region. This initiative provided convenient access to consular services for the community.

Title: Deputy High Commissioner of Sri Lanka to Chennai Dr. D. Venkateshwaran on an Official Visit to Kerala
Summary: Deputy High Commissioner of Sri Lanka to Chennai, Dr. D. Venkateshwaran, conducted an official visit to Kerala last week as part of his engagement with the Southern States of India. During the visit, he held meetings with several state leaders.

Title: Ambassador of Sri Lanka to Slovenia Majintha Jayesinghe presented Letters of Credence in Slovenia
Summary: Ambassador Majintha Jayesinghe of Sri Lanka presented his Letters of Credence to President Borut Pahor of Slovenia at the Presidential Palace in Ljubljana, officially accrediting him as the Ambassador.

Title: The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Japan with the Sri Lankan Expatriates delivers Essential Medical Equipment worth over $225,000 directly to 14 Corona Treatment Hospitals within three weeks of request
Summary: The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Japan, along with Sri Lankan expatriates, donated over $225,000 worth of essential medical equipment to 14 Corona Treatment Hospitals within three weeks of the request. This initiative aimed to support the hospitals in their fight against Covid-19.

Title: Webinar on “EU Market Trends in Agri Products Sector” organized by Sri Lanka Embassy in Germany concludes successfully
Summary: The Sri Lanka Embassy in Germany successfully concluded a webinar on "EU Market Trends in Agri Products Sector" in collaboration with the Import Promotion Desk of Germany and Export Development Board of Sri Lanka.

Title: The Singapore Sri Lanka Business Association (SLBA) donates medical supplies worth 21,717.00 SGD, to the Ministry of Health of Sri Lanka
Summary: The Singapore Sri Lanka Business Association (SLBA) donated medical supplies worth 21,717.00 SGD to the Ministry of Health of Sri Lanka. The supplies were procured using funds raised through a public fundraising campaign.

Title: Poson Full Moon Poya Day – 2021
Summary: The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Norway marked Poson Full Moon Poya Day with an almsgiving and Dhamma sermon. The event commenced with an opening address by Sri Lanka's Ambassador to Norway, Godfre. The celebration aimed to honor this significant Buddhist festival.

Title: Poson – 2021 Celebrations at Sri Lanka Embassy in Lebanon and Syria
Summary: The Poson Poya was celebrated on June 27, 2021, at the Sri Lanka Embassy in Lebanon and Syria, with the participation of Sri Lankans, Lebanese, and Syrians. The event included the presence of Rev. Marathugoda Uparathna Thero of Copenh.

Title: The largest Poson pandal in Europe displayed at the Sri Saddhatissa International Buddhist Centre, Kingsbury
Summary: The largest Poson pandal in Europe was displayed at the Sri Saddhatissa International Buddhist Centre in Kingsbury. High Commissioner of Sri Lanka to the UK, Saroja Sirisena, and staff from the High Commission of Sri Lanka in London participated in the Poson celebrations. The event was organized by the Sri Saddhatissa International Buddhist Centre.

Title: Embassy celebrates Poson Full Moon Poya Day online
Summary: The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Moscow celebrated Poson Full Moon Poya Day online due to the Covid-19 pandemic, featuring live broadcasting on Facebook. The virtual event took place on June 24, 2021, lasting several hours to commemorate the occasion.

Title: Live Bhakthi Gee Telecast from Five Temples with the Embassy in Japan and Dhamma Desana- SLEMB-Tokyo
Summary: The Sri Lanka Mission in Japan sponsored a live Poson Dharma Deshana Programme conducted by Most Ven. Professor Bokalnaruwe Devananda Thero, broadcast from the Hachioji Buddhist Temple in Tokyo. The event was a collaboration between five temples, the Embassy in Japan, and Dhamma Desana- SLEMB-Tokyo.

Title: High Commissioner of Sri Lanka to South Africa met the Sri Lankan Businessmen and Professionals in Durban
Summary: During his official visit to Durban, High Commissioner of Sri Lanka to South Africa, Sirisena Amarasekara, met with Sri Lankan business professionals residing in the city. The meeting aimed to strengthen ties between the Sri Lankan community and South Africa.

Title: Deputy High Commissioner of Sri Lanka in Southern India Doraisamy Venkateshwaran visits Karnataka; seeks cooperation opportunities for Sri Lanka
Summary: Deputy High Commissioner of Sri Lanka in Southern India, Doraisamy Venkateshwaran, visited Karnataka to explore cooperation opportunities for Sri Lanka. He aimed to establish official introductions with the leadership of the states under his consular jurisdiction.

Title: Policies from Sri Lanka receive Future Policy Award 2021 on protection from hazardous chemicals
Summary: Sri Lanka's Control of Pesticides Act No. 33 of 1980 and the National Policy and Action Plan on Prevention of Suicide of 1997 were recognized with the Future Policy Award 2021 for their impact in protecting people from hazardous chemicals. These policies are among the five inspiring laws honored for their significant contributions.

Title: Meeting of the Co-Chairs of the Sri Lanka-Russia Intergovernmental Commission on Trade, Economic, Scientific and Technical Cooperation
Summary: The Co-Chairs of the Sri Lanka-Russia Intergovernmental Commission on Trade, Economic, Scientific, and Technical Cooperation held a video-conference meeting on June 15, 2021. They discussed various aspects of bilateral cooperation during the session.

Title: Contributions made by 99x Technology 4.5million LKR worth of medical equipment to Kalubowila and Wathupitiwala Hospital
Summary: 99x Technology donated medical equipment worth 4.5 million LKR to Kalubowila and Wathupitiwala Hospitals. The Chairman, Dag Honningsvåg, discussed the donation with Ambassador Godfrey Cooray, Minister Counsellor Nilanthini Arulpiragasam, and Embassy staff.

Title: Sri Lankan Embassy in Doha facilitates the donation of 100 Oxygen Cylinders to Sri Lanka
Summary: The Sri Lankan Embassy in Doha facilitated the donation of 100 medical oxygen cylinders, each with a capacity of 50 litres, to the Government of Sri Lanka. This donation aims to bolster Sri Lanka's efforts in combating COVID-19.

Title: Sri Lanka Embassy in Japan Facilitates Three Virtual Investment and Export Webinars
Summary: The Sri Lanka Embassy in Japan organized three virtual investment and export webinars to boost exports to Japan and attract investments to Sri Lanka. These events included a country-specific session at the first-ever virtual Sri Lanka Investment Forum (SLIF).

Title: Meeting with Regional Director of the World Bank
Summary: Ambassador of Sri Lanka to Lebanon Shani Calyaneratne Karunaratne and Second Secretary (Labour) T. Luxmidharan visited the World Bank Regional Headquarters in Beirut, Lebanon, for a courtesy meeting with the Regional Director. The purpose of the visit was to strengthen ties and discuss potential collaborations.

Title: Ambassador of Sri Lanka to China Dr. Palitha Kohona fosters links with the Yong He Lama temple in Beijing
Summary: Ambassador of Sri Lanka to China Dr. Palitha Kohona visited the Yong He Lama temple in Beijing on June 22, 2021, as the VIP guest of Chief Monk Xuefeng Hu. Abbot Hu organized a high-level reception ceremony for the ambassador, fostering closer ties between Sri Lanka and the temple.

Title: Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa meets with Omani Investors
Summary: Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa recently met with a delegation of Omani investors from Shumookh Investment and Services SAOC, the investment arm of Madayn - The Public Establishment for Industrial Estates of the Sultanate. The meeting aimed to discuss potential investment opportunities and strengthen economic ties between Sri Lanka and Oman.

Title: Ambassador of Sri Lanka to Turkey Calls on Director General of Security of Interior Ministry of Republic of Turkey
Summary: Sri Lanka's Ambassador to Turkey, M.R. Hassen, visited the Director General of Security, Mehmet Aktas, at the Interior Ministry of Turkey on June 11, 2021. During the meeting, the Ambassador and Director General exchanged views on matters of mutual interest.

Title: Sri Lanka enhances its ties with the Republic of Kazakhstan
Summary: Sri Lanka strengthens its relationship with the Republic of Kazakhstan through the visit of Ambassador Prof. M.D. Lamawansa and an Embassy delegation including DHM Mohamed Anas and Minister Counsellor Dr. Thama. The delegation's visit aims to enhance diplomatic ties between the two countries.

Title: Sri Lanka International Buddhist Academy (SIBA) and Viet Nam Buddhist University (VBU) in Ho Chi Minh City, enters into a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) on Buddhist Religious Education and Cultural Cooperation
Summary: The Sri Lanka International Buddhist Academy (SIBA) in Pallekele, Kandy, and the Viet Nam Buddhist University (VBU) in Ho Chi Minh City signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) on Buddhist Religious Education and Cultural Cooperation on June 19, 2021. The agreement was facilitated by the Sri Lankan Embassy in Viet Nam, fostering collaboration between the two institutions.

Title: Donation of Nebulizers, Infrared Forehead Thermometers, Sanitizer Nano Spray Guns and Mattresses to COVID – 19 Intermediate Treatment Center of District Hospital – Dompe
Summary: The Embassy of Sri Lanka to Lebanon and Syria donated Nebulizers, Infrared Forehead Thermometers, Sanitizer Nano Spray Guns, mattresses, and alternative mosquito netting to the COVID-19 Intermediate Treatment Center at District Hospital - Dompe, which has 300 beds. This donation aims to support the newly established treatment center in providing essential medical equipment and supplies for patient care.

Title: Donation of another 125 Oxygen Cylinders and 10 Oxygen Regulators from Doha-Qatar to reinforce the Health Sector in Sri Lanka
Summary: The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Doha facilitated the second air shipment of 125 Oxygen Cylinders and 10 Oxygen Regulators from Doha-Qatar to support the health sector in Sri Lanka. This donation aims to strengthen the country's healthcare capacity in response to the ongoing challenges.

Title: Science and Trade relations between countries are core of the Diplomatic relations in the 4IR (Fourth Industrial Revolution) Era
Summary: The High Commissioner of Sri Lanka to South Africa, Amarasekara, recently hosted a luncheon at his official residence for high-ranking officials, emphasizing the importance of science and trade relations in the Fourth Industrial Revolution era. Diplomatic relations are increasingly centered around these core aspects in the modern global landscape.

Title: Ambassador of Sri Lanka to China Dr. Palitha Kohona attends “2021 China Rural Revitalization International Summit Forum” in Guizhou Province
Summary: Ambassador Dr. Palitha Kohona attended the "2021 China Rural Revitalization International Summit Forum" in Xingyi City, Qianxinan, Guizhou Province on May 30, 2021. The forum was organized by the China Council for the Promotion of International Trade.

Title: Ambassador of Sri Lanka to Sweden talks with Swedish Foreign Minister Ann Linde
Summary: Sri Lanka's Ambassador to Sweden, Dharshana M. Perera, held discussions with Swedish Foreign Minister Ann Linde in Stockholm on June 8, 2021. The talks centered on various aspects of bilateral relations between the two countries.

Title: Ambassador of Sri Lanka to Kazakhstan Prof. M.D. Lamawansa presents credentials to Kazakhstan President
Summary: Ambassador of Sri Lanka to Kazakhstan Prof. M.D. Lamawansa presented his Letters of Credence to Kazakhstan President Kassym-Jomart Tokayev in a restricted ceremony at Acorda Presidentia. This formal presentation signifies the official start of his diplomatic mission in Kazakhstan.

Title: Bridging over 100 Sri Lankan ICT Companies with UAE Market
Summary: The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Abu Dhabi, along with the Export Development Board (EDB) and the Consulate General of Sri Lanka in Dubai, organized a webinar to connect over 100 Sri Lankan ICT companies with the UAE market. This initiative aims to facilitate business opportunities and partnerships between the two countries.

Title: China Sri Lanka Association for Trade and Economic Cooperation (CSLATE) was inaugurated at the Embassy of Sri Lanka
Summary: The China Sri Lanka Association for Trade and Economic Cooperation (CSLATE) was officially inaugurated on June 15, 2021, at the Embassy of Sri Lanka. CSLATE aims to strengthen trade and investment cooperation between China and Sri Lanka.

Title: Ministerial Visit to St. Petersburg International Economic Forum from 2-5 June 2021
Summary: Minister of Industries of Sri Lanka, Wimal Weerawansa, and State Minister of Money & Capital Market, Ajith Nivard Cabraal, attended the XXIV St. Petersburg International Economic Forum from 2-5 June 2021.

Title: Generous gift of medical equipment and other material to Sri Lanka by an Ingo in the Republic of Korea
Summary: The International Interchange Development Association (IIDA), led by Moon Yong-Jo, has donated a Cancer Detection and Prevention Machine and a significant amount of sanitary products to Sri Lanka. This generous gift of medical equipment aims to support healthcare efforts in the country.

Title: Sri Lanka Embassy facilitates Donation of Medical Items from the Kuwait Red Crescent Society
Summary: The Sri Lanka Embassy facilitated a donation of urgently needed medical items from the Kuwait Red Crescent Society to help the Sri Lankan government contain the spread of COVID-19. The donation followed a recent meeting with the Ambassador of Sri Lanka to Kuwait, U. L. Moham, strengthening bilateral cooperation in healthcare.

Title: Visit of Maldive fish production centres, proposed maldive fish processing, value addition and sales centre and proposed site for the establishment of public marine aquarium
Summary: Ambassador of Sri Lanka to Norway, Iceland, and Finland, Godfrey Cooray, was invited by the Director General of the National Aquatic Resources Research and Development Agency (NARA), Dr. H.M.P. Kithsiri, to visit Maldives fish production centers, proposed processing and sales centers, and a site for a public marine aquarium establishment. This visit aims to explore opportunities for enhancing the Maldives fish industry and promoting marine conservation efforts.

Title: Sri Lanka Embassy in Germany felicitates Equestrian Mathilda Karlsson ahead of 2020 Tokyo Olympics
Summary: The Sri Lanka Embassy in Germany honored equestrian Mathilda Karlsson, who will represent Sri Lanka at the 2020 Tokyo Olympics. Mathilda Karlsson, a Sri Lankan-born equestrian, is set to compete in the upcoming Games.

Title: Meeting with Head of Mission of Medecins Sans Frontieres
Summary: Ambassador of Sri Lanka to Lebanon Shani Calyaneratne Karunaratne and Second Secretary/Labour T. Luxmidharan recently met with Julien Raickman, the Head of Mission at Medecins Sans Frontieres as part of the Embassy’s outreach program.

Title: Charge d’ Affaires a.i. of Sri Lanka to Italy met with the President of Toscana Region
Summary: The Charge d’Affaires a.i. of the Sri Lanka Embassy in Rome, Sisira Senavirathne, met with the President of Toscana Region, E. Eugenio Giano, at Piazza Duomo in Florence on June 5, 2021. They discussed enhancing cooperation between Sri Lanka and the Toscana Region.

Title: Attending agreement signing function between Institute of Marine Research Norway and National Aquatic Resources Research and Development Agency
Summary: Sri Lanka's Ambassador to Norway, Godfrey Cooray, attended the agreement signing function between the Institute of Marine Research (IMR) Norway and the National Aquatic Resources Research and Development Agency (NARA). The event aimed to strengthen collaboration between the two organizations in the field of marine research.

Title: Sri Lankan Products record high sale at SPAR Oman
Summary: Sri Lankan products have achieved a record high in sales at SPAR Oman, with three-quarters of the goods exported under the initiative by the Sri Lankan Embassy in Oman being sold within just fifteen days. SPAR International confirmed this success in a recent statement.

Title: Envoy discusses promotion of Culture, Sports and Tourism with the Vice Minister of the Republic of Korea
Summary: Sri Lankan Ambassador Dr. A. Saj U. Mendis met with Republic of Korea's Vice Minister of Culture, Sports, and Tourism Kim Jeongbae to discuss promoting cultural exchanges. Kim Jeongbae holds the second-highest political position in the ministry.

Title: Sri Lanka Embassy in Doha facilitates the first shipment of 150 Oxygen Cylinders and Pulse Oximeters to Sri Lanka
Summary: The Sri Lanka Embassy in Doha facilitated the first air shipment of 150 Oxygen Cylinders and 22 Pulse Oximeters to support the Government of Sri Lanka in its fight against the COVID-19 pandemic. This donation aims to assist Sri Lanka in addressing its urgent healthcare needs during these challenging times.

Title: Sri Lanka – Oman Maritime Cooperation to be enhanced
Summary: Sri Lanka's Ambassador to Oman, Ameer Ajwad, met with Oman's Minister of Transport, Communications, and Information Technology, Eng. Saeed bin Hamoud Al-Maawali, to discuss enhancing maritime cooperation between the two countries. The meeting aimed to strengthen collaboration in various areas related to maritime activities.

Title: Ceylon Teas are Now Available at the Ambassador Duty-Free in Pretoria
Summary: Pure Ceylon Tea is now available at the Ambassador Duty-Free in Pretoria, South Africa, marking a significant milestone for the tea in Southern Africa. Sri Lanka Cricket has also been involved in this development.

Title: Tourism Event with SriLankan Airlines
Summary: The Sri Lanka Embassy in the Russian Federation, in collaboration with SriLankan Airlines, hosted a tourism event on May 28, 2021, at the embassy premises. The event aimed to engage tourism companies in Moscow to mark the resumption of tourism activities.

Title: Engaging with seafood stakeholders at the Aquatic Products Exchange Meeting
Summary: Consul General of Sri Lanka in Guangzhou, Priyangika Dharmasena, engaged with seafood stakeholders at the Aquatic Products Exchange Meeting organized by the Guangzhou Aquatic Production Chamber of Commerce on 25 May 2021. The meeting aimed to foster collaboration and discussions within the seafood industry.

Title: Generous Support extended towards the country by a Sri Lankan Muslim Brother in UAE
Summary: A Sri Lankan Muslim brother in the UAE generously supported Sri Lanka by donating medical equipment and providing monetary assistance in response to the Ambassador's call for aid. Ambassador Malraj De Silva invited Sri Lankans in the UAE to contribute towards the country's urgent needs.

Title: Ambassador M. Mafaz Mohideen meets Secretary-General of Qatar Red Crescent Society (QRCS) Ali bin Hassan Al- Hammadi
Summary: Ambassador M. Mafaz Mohideen met with the Secretary-General of Qatar Red Crescent Society (QRCS), Ali bin Hassan Al-Hammadi, on June 1, 2021. The meeting was also attended by the Head of International Relations and International Humanitarian Law. They discussed collaboration and humanitarian efforts.

Title: Meeting with Chief Executive Officer of ICC-Afghanistan
Summary: Ambassador of Sri Lanka to Afghanistan, Admiral Piyal De Silva, visited the International Chamber of Commerce in Afghanistan (ICC) on May 24, 2021. He delivered a presentation aimed at educating businessmen and businesswomen. The meeting was held to enhance business knowledge and opportunities in Afghanistan.

Title: Sri Lanka High Commission in London celebrates Vesak
Summary: The Sri Lanka High Commission in London celebrated Vesak from May 26-30, 2021, following UK Government Covid-19 guidelines. The festivities commenced with a ceremony at the High Commission premises. The event aimed to honor the significance of Vesak in the Sri Lankan culture.

Title: Participation of Sri Lankan Embassy at the Congress of the International League of Young Scientists on 21 May, 2021, Moscow region
Summary: The Sri Lankan Embassy's Tea Promotion Unit participated in the Congress of the International League of Young Scientists on May 21, 2021, in the Moscow region. The event coincided with the International Tea Day.

Title: “Vesak Celebrations – 2021” in Moscow
Summary: In 2021, Vesak celebrations took place in Moscow, Russia, organized by the Embassy in partnership with the Sri Lankan Business and Professionals Society and Sri Lankan students. The events were held on 26 May 2021.

Title: Sri Lanka nominated as the Vice Chair from the ASPAC Group for the intergovernmental meeting of experts (category ii) related to a draft UNESCO Recommendation on Open Science
Summary: Sri Lanka has been nominated as the Vice Chair from the ASPAC Group for the intergovernmental meeting of experts regarding a draft UNESCO Recommendation on Open Science. Ambassador Prof. Kshanika Hirimburagama will represent the Asia Pacific Group in this capacity.

Title: Sri Lanka Deputy High Commissioner-designate to Deputy High Commissioner of Sri Lanka in Chennai-India assumed duties
Summary: Dr. Doraisamy Venkateshwaran officially began his role as the Deputy High Commissioner of Sri Lanka in Chennai, India on April 12, 2021. He assumed his duties at the Deputy High Commission Office in Chennai.

Title: Envoys of India and Sri Lanka Meets to Discuss Strategies for Strengthening Indo- Sri Lanka Co-corporation with South Africa
Summary: Envoys of India and Sri Lanka met in South Africa to discuss strategies for enhancing cooperation with South Africa. The High Commissioner of India, Jaideep Sarkar, invited the High Commissioner of Sri Lanka, Sirisena Amar, for the meeting. The discussions aimed to strengthen Indo-Sri Lanka cooperation in South Africa.

Title: Vesak Celebration at the Sri Lanka Deputy High Commission, Chennai – 2021
Summary: The Sri Lanka Deputy High Commission in Chennai organized a "Bodhi Pooja" event to celebrate Vesak full moon poya day on May 26, 2021, at the Chancery premises. The event was held under guidance and marked a significant observance of the occasion.

Title: Celebration of International Day of Vesak at the UN Office in Vienna
Summary: The Permanent Mission and the United Nations Office in Vienna (UNOV) celebrated the International Day of Vesak virtually on May 26, 2021. This marked the first time the International Day of Vesak was celebrated at the UN Office in Vienna.

Title: Sri Lanka Embassy in Brussels celebrates Vesak
Summary: The Sri Lanka Embassy in Brussels celebrated Vesak with a religious program at the Official Residence on May 30, 2021, attended by the Sri Lankan community in Belgium. The Vesak program was presided over by V.

Title: Vesak – 2021 Sil Program at Sri Lanka Embassy in Lebanon and Syria
Summary: The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Lebanon and Syria celebrated the Vesak sil program on May 26 and 30, 2021. The event was led by Rev. Marathugoda Uparathna Thero from the Copenhagen Buddhist Temple in Denmark.

Title: Xu Shi Yin’e, the “Lanka Princess” attends the Vesak celebrations 2021 at the Embassy in Beijing on 26 May 2021
Summary: Xu Shi Yin’e, known as the “Lanka Princess,” participated in the Vesak celebrations 2021 at the Embassy in Beijing on May 26, 2021. Before the event, she met with Ambassador Dr. Palitha Kohona at his residence and shared details about her family.

Title: Sri Lanka High Commission Celebrates Vesak in Canberra
Summary: The Sri Lanka High Commission in Canberra celebrated Vesak 2021 with an alms giving and Dhamma sermon. High Commission staff also offered Buddha Pooja at the Sri Lanka Buddhist Vihara in Canberra on Vesak day. The event aimed to commemorate the significance of Vesak in the Buddhist calendar.

Title: Vesak – 2021 Celebrations at Sri Lanka Embassy in Norway
Summary: The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Norway celebrated the Vesak festival on May 27, 2021, with Embassy staff and Thisarana Buddhist Association at the Embassy and Sri Lanka Buddhist Vihara. The event marked a meaningful observance of Vesak with the participation of these groups.

Title: Vesak celebrates at Sri Lanka Embassy in Tokyo
Summary: The Sri Lanka Embassy in Tokyo celebrated Vesak by inviting Venerable Mawarale Bhaddiya Thero for a Dhamma Sermon on Vesak Day. The event took place on 28 May 2021 at the Embassy premises and was attended by the Ambassador.

Title: To Commemorate the Vesak Day-2021 (2564 B.E.), Sri Lanka Embassy and Permanent Mission in Thailand collaborating with True Corporation PLC, Thailand, launched the telecast of 31 episodes of “True Little Monk” on Haritha TV, Sri Lanka
Summary: To commemorate Vesak Day 2021 (2564 B.E.), the Sri Lanka Embassy and Permanent Mission in Thailand, in collaboration with True Corporation PLC, launched the telecast of 31 episodes of the award-winning documentary series "True Little Monk" on Haritha TV in Sri Lanka. The telecast began on the Vesak Full Moon Poya Day, 26 May 2021.

Title: Vesak Festival celebrated in Jakarta
Summary: The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Indonesia celebrated Vesak at its premises on May 25, 2021, following Covid-19 health and safety protocols mandated by the Indonesian government. The celebrations marked the occasion with adherence to safety measures.

Title: Vesak celebrates at Sri Lanka Embassy in Muscat
Summary: The Embassy of Sri Lanka and the Buddhist community in Oman celebrated Vesak Poya Day 2021 while following the health guidelines of the host country amidst the COVID-19 pandemic. The event took place at the Chancery and Sri Sambuddhatwa Ja, marking a significant observance for the community in Muscat.

Title: Vesak celebrations in Jordan
Summary: The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Jordan celebrated Vesak at the Chancery with the Sri Lankan community, following Covid-19 health protocols. A Heel Dana event was organized during the celebration.

Title: “Dubai Vesak Sathiya 2021″
Summary: The Consul General of Sri Lanka to Dubai and Northern Emirates, Nalinda Wijerathna, and the staff of the Consulate General office collaborated with Dubai Lankaramaya and Sri Lanka Community Associations in the UAE for the Dubai Vesak Sathiya 2021 event.

Title: Vesak Day Celebrations in Frankfurt am Main
Summary: The Consulate General of Sri Lanka in Frankfurt am Main organized an almsgiving ceremony for monks of Sri Lankan Buddhist Temples to celebrate Vesak Poya Day 2021. The event was attended by the Consul General and consulate staff.

Title: Commemoration of Vesak Full Moon Poya Day in Kuwait
Summary: The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Kuwait held a virtual Dhamma Deshana event to commemorate Vesak Full Moon Poya Day on May 26, 2021. Ven. Dehipe Chandawimala Thero from Wewalduw delivered the event at the Embassy premises.

Title: Vesak celebrated at the white house for the first time
Summary: For the first time, the White House celebrated Vesak on Tuesday, attended by Second Gentleman Douglas Emhoff, husband of Vice President Kamala Harris. The ceremony was conducted with.

Title: High Commissioner Saroja Sirisena calls on the Speaker of the House of Commons
Summary: High Commissioner of Sri Lanka to the UK, Saroja Sirisena, met with the Speaker of the House of Commons, Sir Lindsay Hoyle, on 24 May 2021. The meeting was part of Sir Lindsay's initiative to engage with Heads of Mission in London.

Title: Sri Lanka Embassy in Berlin celebrates Vesak
Summary: The Sri Lanka Embassy in Berlin celebrated Vesak on 27 May 2021 virtually, with a limited number of invitees at the Embassy premises, following Covid restrictions. The event marked the occasion with a scaled-down gathering in compliance with safety measures.

Title: “Vesak Festival celebrated in Manila”
Summary: The Embassy of Sri Lanka in the Philippines and the Universal Wisdom Foundation Inc. celebrated the Vesak Festival at Wisdom Park in Manila on May 26, 2021, while following COVID-19 protocols. The event took place at the Buddhist resource center, marking an important cultural and religious celebration.

Title: Sri Lanka Embassy in Beijing Celebrates Vesak 2021
Summary: The Sri Lanka Embassy in Beijing celebrated Vesak 2021, honoring the birth, enlightenment, and passing away of Lord Buddha on May 26. The event was attended by over 150 invitees, including Ambassadors from Buddhist countries. The celebration marked an important cultural and religious event for the attendees.

Title: High Commissioner Kananathan participates in Vesak day celebrations at Uganda Buddhist Centre
Summary: High Commissioner Veluppillai Kananathan of Sri Lanka attended the Vesak day celebrations at Uganda Buddhist Centre in Entebbe, following an invitation from Venerable Bhante Buddharakkhita, the chief incumbent.

Title: Vesak – 2021 Celebrations at Sri Lanka Embassy in Lebanon and Syria
Summary: The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Lebanon and Syria celebrated Vesak on May 26, 2021, with a ceremony at the embassy premises. The event was conducted by Rev. Marathugoda Uparathna Thero from the Copenhagen Buddhist Temple in Denmark via Zoom.

Title: Participation of Consulate General of Sri Lanka at Celebration of International Tea Day at the Press Conference of 2021 China (Guangzhou) International Tea Expo and tea Savouring
Summary: The Consulate General of Sri Lanka in Guangzhou participated in the celebration of International Tea Day at the Press Conference of the 2021 China (Guangzhou) International Tea Expo. This event was organized by the China (Guangzhou) Tea Expo 2021 organizers.

Title: The Embassy of Sri Lanka in the United Arab Emirates Celebrates Vesak
Summary: The Embassy of Sri Lanka in the United Arab Emirates marked Vesak on 26 May 2021 at its premises, observing the occasion in a subdued manner due to the COVID-19 pandemic. The celebration included limited participation in compliance with health guidelines.

Title: Ambassador Dr. Palitha Kohona attends International Tea Day Ceremony   in Hangzhou, Zhejiang
Summary: Ambassador Dr. Palitha Kohona, along with Assistant Director Sampath Perera and Tea Promotions Officer, attended the 2021 International Tea Day Ceremony in Hangzhou, Zhejiang. The event took place at the 4th China.

Title: City of Kawaguchi Donates an Ambulance
Summary: The Mayor of Kawaguchi City in Japan, Nobuo Okunoki, donated a high-quality used ambulance to Sri Lanka upon a request from Ambassador Sanjiv Gunasekara during a meeting. The donation aims to support emergency medical services in Sri Lanka.

Title: Vesak celebrated in Nepal with religious observances and illuminations
Summary: Vesak, also known as Buddha Jayanthi, is celebrated in Nepal with religious observances and illuminations. The festival honors Prince Siddhartha, who later became Buddha, born to King Suddhodana and Queen Maya Devi in present-day Tilaur, as part of the Shakya dynasty of Kapilavastu.

Title: Embassy of Sri Lanka in France and the Permanent Delegation of Sri Lanka to UNESCO Virtually Commemorate International Day of Vesak
Summary: The Embassy of Sri Lanka in France and the Permanent Delegation of Sri Lanka to UNESCO virtually commemorated the International Day of Vesak, honoring the Birth, Enlightenment, and Parinibbana of Lord Buddha. The event was organized to mark this significant occasion.

Title: Permanent Missions of Sri Lanka and Thailand to the United Nations co-host a virtual commemoration for International Day of Vesak
Summary: The Permanent Missions of Sri Lanka and Thailand co-hosted a virtual commemoration for the International Day of Vesak at the United Nations on May 25, 2021. The event celebrated the significance of Vesak, a major Buddhist festival, in promoting peace and harmony.

Title: Sri Lanka Mission in Tokyo, Japan conducts online programme on “Technical Intern Training Programme to Educate Sri Lankan Youth to come to Japan legally”
Summary: The Sri Lanka Mission in Tokyo, Japan conducted the second part of its four-part online program on the "Technical Intern Training Programme" to educate Sri Lankan youth on legal ways to come to Japan. The program was organized by the Sri Lanka Embassy in Tokyo.

Title: Seven flavours of Ceylon Tea celebrated in Melbourne on International Tea Day
Summary: Seven regional flavours of Ceylon tea were celebrated in Melbourne, Australia on International Tea Day at a special "Ceylon Tea Evening" organized by the Consulate General of Sri Lanka. The event was attended by a multicultural audience, highlighting the diverse tea offerings from Sri Lanka.

Title: Exploring Sri Lankan Markets in Maritime Economy, Renewable Energies and Mineral Resources: Interactive Meeting with Sri Lanka Embassy in Paris and MEDEF International
Summary: A high-level webinar on Maritime Economy was organized by MEDEF and the International Maritime Task Force in collaboration with the Sri Lanka Embassy in France in March 2021. The interactive meeting explored Sri Lankan markets in maritime economy, renewable energies, and mineral resources, fostering international cooperation.

Title: Online Workshop on the Development of Recreational Boating and Marina in Sri Lanka
Summary: An online workshop on the Development of Recreational Boating Industry in Sri Lanka was successfully conducted on May 11, 2021, by the Commercial section of the High Commission of Sri Lanka in Singapore. The workshop aimed to enhance the development of recreational boating and marina facilities in Sri Lanka.

Title: Webinar on Prospects of Belarus-Sri Lanka Bilateral Trade Development
Summary: A webinar discussing the prospects of Belarus-Sri Lanka bilateral trade development was held following the official visit of the Sri Lankan Ambassador to the Russian Federation with a delegation to Belarus in December 2020. This visit aimed to strengthen bilateral relations between the two countries.

Title: Donation of 60 (Sixty) Optimal Fingertip Pulse Oximeters Sri Lanka Embassy of Lebanon and Syria
Summary: The Embassy of Sri Lanka to Lebanon and Syria, along with several well-wishers, donated 60 optimal fingertip pulse oximeters to Sri Lanka due to the rising number of COVID-19 patients in the country. This donation aims to support Sri Lanka's healthcare system during the pandemic.

Title: “Ceylon Cinnamon Tea” launched in Oman coinciding with International Tea Day
Summary: Ambassador of Sri Lanka to Oman, Ameer Ajwad, launched the new brand "Ceylon Cinnamon Tea" at AI Meera Hypermarket in Muscat on May 21, 2021, in celebration of International Tea Day. The launch aimed to promote the unique blend of Ceylon tea infused with cinnamon flavors in the Omani market.

Title: Sri Lankan Airline flight departs from Beijing carrying 500,000 Sinopharm Vaccine Doses
Summary: A Sri Lankan Airline flight departed from Beijing at 19:30 hrs. on 25 May 2021 (Beijing time), carrying 500,000 Sinopharm vaccine doses gifted by China to Sri Lanka. This marks the second consignment of vaccines donated by China to Sri Lanka.

Title: Ramadan celebration at the Consulate General of Sri Lanka in Frankfurt am Main
Summary: The Consulate General of Sri Lanka in Frankfurt am Main celebrated Eid ul-Fitr to mark the end of Ramadan. The event was attended by community leaders and the Hon. Consul of Sri Lanka to the Federation. It was a gathering to commemorate the holy month.

Title: National Film Corporation establishes links with Turkish Cinema Industry
Summary: The National Film Corporation of Sri Lanka (NFC) has established links with the Directorate of Cinema of the Ministry of Culture and Tourism of Turkey through a virtual meeting organized by the Mission. This collaboration aims to strengthen ties between the two countries' film industries.

Title: “Ceylon Tea: An Industry Gold Standard” – An Exclusive   International Tea Day Promotion with Art Plus Magazine
Summary: The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Manila, along with Art Plus Magazine and the Sri Lanka Tea Board, hosted an exclusive social media promotion highlighting Ceylon Tea in honor of International Tea Day. The event showcased Ceylon Tea as a gold standard in the industry, aligning with the global celebration of tea.

Title: China gifts another batch consisting of 500,000 doses of Covid-19 Sinopharm  vaccine to Sri Lanka
Summary: China has confirmed the gift of another 500,000 doses of Sinopharm vaccine to Sri Lanka. The announcement was made to the Sri Lankan Ambassador in Beijing, Dr. Palitha Kohona, by the Chinese Foreign Ministry on May 19, 2021. This donation adds to China's ongoing support in combating the Covid-19 pandemic in Sri Lanka.

Title: Ambassador, Dr. Palitha Kohona, Meets president Tian Hongqi of the Central South University (CSU), Changsha, Hu’nan
Summary: Ambassador Dr. Palitha Kohona met with President Tian Hongqi of Central South University (CSU) in Changsha, Hu’nan. They discussed increasing placements for Sri Lankan students at CSU and explored the potential for establishing new partnerships.

Title: Ambassador Aryasinha calls for contribution of relief goods and donations from OSLs & Friends in the face of the COVID urgency in Sri Lanka
Summary: Sri Lanka's Ambassador to the USA, Ravinatha Aryasinha, urged Overseas Sri Lankans (OSLs) and Friends of Sri Lanka in the US to contribute relief goods and donations to address the COVID-19 crisis in Sri Lanka. The embassy has been working with the US Government and manufacturers to secure vaccines for the country.

Title: The last batch of detained Sri Lankan migrant workers in Saudi Arabia returns to Sri Lanka
Summary: The repatriation of Sri Lankan migrant workers detained in Riyadh and Jeddah has concluded, with the last batch of 103 detainees returning to Sri Lanka on Saudi Airlines SV 786 on 19 May.

Title: Erzurum Chamber of Commerce & Industry in Turkey linked with the National Chamber of Commerce of Sri Lanka
Summary: The Erzurum Chamber of Commerce & Industry in Turkey has established a connection with the National Chamber of Commerce of Sri Lanka to boost trade relations. An introductory virtual meeting was arranged on 07 May 2021 with the assistance of the Honorary Consul of Sri Lanka to the Eastern Anatolian Region, Fatih Yucelik.

Title: Ambassador Dr. Palitha Kohona attends the 5th Silk Road International Expo and China East-West Cooperation and Investment and Trade Fair in Xi’an, Shaanxi
Summary: Ambassador Dr. Palitha Kohona attended the 5th Silk Road International Expo and China East-West Cooperation and Investment and Trade Fair in Xi'an, Shaanxi Province on 12 May 2021. He was invited to participate in the event, showcasing collaboration opportunities between China and other countries.

Title: Embassy of Sri Lanka in Washington D.C hosts Iftar celebration
Summary: The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Washington D.C hosted an Iftar celebration on May 10, 2021, at the official residence, attended by a representative group of the Sri Lankan Muslim community residing in the Greater Washington area. The event aimed to foster cultural exchange and community engagement.

Title: Ambassador Dr. Palitha Kohona attends the 5th Global Cross-boarder E-commerce conference in Zhengzhou, Henan Province
Summary: Ambassador Dr. Palitha Kohona attended the 5th Global Cross-border E-commerce conference in Zhengzhou, Henan Province on May 10, 2021. The conference was hosted by Deputy Governor of Henan Province, Jinping He.

Title: Sri Lanka High Commission in South Africa Kicks Off a New Series of  B2B Meetings
Summary: The Sri Lanka High Commission in South Africa has launched a new series of B2B meetings in partnership with the Department of Commerce and the Exports Development Board of Sri Lanka. The aim is to explore fresh opportunities for Sri Lankan businesses.

Title: Award ceremony at the Korea Press Federation which honored the embassy of Sri Lanka
Summary: The Korea Press Federation and Seoul Press Club honored Ambassador of Sri Lanka to the Republic of Korea Dr. A. Saj U. Mendis at an award ceremony for his efforts in promoting international relations. The event took place at the Korea Press Federation and recognized the embassy of Sri Lanka.

Title: Stall for “Sri Lankan Products” opened at SPAR Supermarket in Oman
Summary: The Ambassador of Sri Lanka to Oman, Ameer Ajwad, inaugurated a dedicated stall for "Sri Lankan products" at the SPAR supermarket in Madinat Al Sultan Qaboos, Oman, alongside the CEO of SP. This initiative aims to promote Sri Lankan goods in Oman and enhance bilateral trade relations between the two countries.

Title: Embassy of Sri Lanka in Moscow receives a delegation from Muslim community for Iftar
Summary: The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Moscow hosted an Iftar ceremony on April 28, 2021, for the Chief Imam of Moscow Cathedral Mosque and the Muslim community delegation. The event was organized by Deputy Head of Mission and Minister Counsellor Mohamed Anas on behalf of Ambassador Prof. M.D. Lamawansa.

Title: Meeting with Acting Minster of Information and Culture of Afghanistan
Summary: Ambassador of Sri Lanka to Afghanistan, Admiral Piyal De Silva, met with Acting Minister of Information and Culture Tahir Zuhair on May 9, 2021, at the Ministry of Information and Culture in Afghanistan. The meeting aimed to discuss bilateral cooperation and cultural exchanges between the two countries.

Title: High Commissioner Kananathan presents Credentials in Uganda
Summary: High Commissioner Veluppillai Kananathan presented his credentials to Ugandan President Yoweri Kaguta Museveni, officially assuming the role of Sri Lanka's High Commissioner to Uganda with residence in Kenya.

Title: Showcasing a proud Sri Lankan
Summary: The High Commission of Sri Lanka in the UK has launched a platform to highlight Sri Lankans who have excelled, attributing their success to the public goods provided by the country's governments since independence. This initiative aims to showcase the achievements made possible by decades of government support.

Title: The Sixteenth Informal Meeting of the SAARC Finance Ministers
Summary: The Sixteenth Informal Meeting of the SAARC Finance Ministers took place virtually on May 5, 2021, from 1:30 PM to 3:30 PM Manila Time. The meeting was held alongside the 54th Annual Meeting of the Asian Development Bank (ADB).

Title: Ambassador of Sri Lanka presents credentials to the Netherlands based Organization for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons (OPCW)
Summary: Ambassador Aruni Ranaraja presented her credentials as the Permanent Representative of Sri Lanka to the Organization for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons (OPCW) in the Netherlands. The Director General of the OPCW, Dr. Fernando Arias, officially received her credentials.

Title: Webinar on “Accelerating Growth of Food Sector” Buyer –Seller Meet between Sri Lanka and Singapore 27 April 2021
Summary: A webinar on "Accelerating Growth of Food Sector" and a Buyer-Seller Meet between Sri Lanka and Singapore took place on April 27, 2021. The event was organized as part of the FYIstival South Asia Edition of Global Connect at the Singapore Business Federation (SBF), in collaboration with Ente.

Title: Construction Industry Stakeholders of Sri Lanka and Nepal discuss areas to strengthen collaboration
Summary: The Sri Lanka Embassy in Nepal, in collaboration with the Export Development Board of Sri Lanka (EDB), organized a webinar titled "Collaboration in the Construction Industry" to connect industry stakeholders from both countries. The webinar aimed to discuss and identify areas for strengthening collaboration between the construction sectors of Sri Lanka and Nepal.

Title: Sri Lankan Vannamei Prawns captures the Jordanian market
Summary: Sri Lankan Vannamei Prawns have successfully entered the Jordanian market, with the Sri Lanka Embassy in Jordan securing an order of 5.6 metric tons as part of its economic diplomacy initiative to promote high-value aquaculture commodities from Sri Lanka. This achievement highlights the growing presence of Sri Lankan prawns in Jordan, showcasing the success of the initiative.

Title: Sri Lanka Investment Webinar for Guangdong enterprises to invest in Sri   Lanka
Summary: The Consulate General of Sri Lanka in Guangzhou, in collaboration with the Guangdong Department of Commerce, organized a Sri Lanka investment webinar on April 29, 2021. The webinar aimed to facilitate investments by Guangdong enterprises in Sri Lanka, with the participation of the Board o.

Title: Sri Lanka calls for stronger regional cooperation for building back better from the pandemic through promotion of trade, investment and foreign employment opportunities at the 77th Session of the UNESCAP in Bangkok
Summary: Sri Lanka's Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa emphasized the need for stronger regional cooperation to recover from the pandemic at the 77th Session of the UNESCAP in Bangkok. He highlighted the importance of promoting trade, investment, and foreign employment opportunities for building back better in Asia and the Pacific.

Title: Sri Lanka Embassy in Turkey distributes Ramadhan aid to villages in Yaylabag
Summary: The Sri Lanka Embassy in Turkey, led by Ambassador M.R. Hassen and staff, along with Honorary Consuls, distributed Ramadhan aid packages, including groceries, to villages in Yaylabag.

Title: Webinar on “Grow Beyond Traditional Markets” for the Sri Lankan Exporters to enter into Israeli market
Summary: The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Tel Aviv, in collaboration with the National Chamber of Exporters (NCE) of Sri Lanka and the Federation of Israeli Chambers of Commerce, organized a webinar titled "Grow Beyond Traditional Markets" on April 28, 2021. The webinar aimed to assist Sri Lankan exporters in entering the Israeli market.

Title: Sri Lanka High Commission in Pretoria kicks off the initiative to obtain assistance from the Sri Lankan expatriates in South Africa
Summary: The Sri Lanka High Commission in Pretoria initiated a virtual meeting between KDU Vice Chancellor Major General Milinda Peiris, KDU staff, and expatriate Sri Lankan Prof Chandima Gomes to seek assistance from Sri Lankan expatriates in South Africa. This collaboration aims to leverage the expertise and support of the Sri Lankan community in South Africa for mutual benefit.

Title: Sri Lanka Seeks to Enhance Links with Uzbekistan
Summary: Sri Lanka's Embassy delegation, led by Ambassador Prof. M.D. Lamawansa, recently visited Uzbekistan to strengthen bilateral ties. The delegation engaged in high-level meetings in Tashkent's Ministries during the 4-day visit. Sri Lanka aims to enhance its connections with Uzbekistan through these diplomatic efforts.

Title: Ambassador Prof. M.D. Lamawansa meets Director of the National Information Analytical Center for Drug Control in Tashkent.
Summary: Ambassador Prof. M.D. Lamawansa and the Sri Lankan Embassy delegation, including First Secretary Nirosha Herath, visited the Director of the National Information Analytical Center for Drug Control in Tashkent during their first official visit to Uzbekistan. The visit was a courtesy call to strengthen diplomatic ties between the two countries.

Title: State Minister of Money & Capital Market and State Enterprise Reforms Ajith Nivard Cabraal visits the State of Qatar
Summary: State Minister of Money & Capital Market and State Enterprise Reforms Ajith Nivard Cabraal led a Sri Lankan delegation during their visit to the State of Qatar from April 10-12, 2021. The visit was organized by the Embassy of Sri Lanka in Doha.

Title: Ambassador Dr. Palitha Kohona speaks at the Opening Ceremony of the 2021 China (Zhengzhou) International Mayor’s Forum on Tourism
