Summary: Ambassador Dr. Palitha Kohona spoke at the Opening Ceremony of the 2021 China (Zhengzhou) International Mayor’s Forum on Tourism held from 21 – 22 April 2021. The forum was organized by the Ministry of Culture and Tourism.

Title: Sri Lanka – Oman Bilateral Cooperation in Food Sector Mooted
Summary: Ambassador of Sri Lanka to Oman, Ameer Ajwad, met with CEO Saleh M. Al Shanfari of Oman Food Investment Holding Co. to discuss enhancing bilateral cooperation in the food sector. The meeting aimed to promote collaboration between the two countries in food-related initiatives.

Title: The first group of Sri Lankans held at the ‘Tarheel’ deportation camp in Riyadh to return to Sri Lanka tomorrow
Summary: The first group of Sri Lankans held at the 'Tarheel' deportation camp in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, will return to Sri Lanka on Friday. Subsequently, a second and third group will also be repatriated.

Title: Sri Lanka Embassy facilitates Repatriation of over 6000 Migrant Workers from Kuwait
Summary: The Sri Lanka Embassy in Kuwait, under the guidance of Foreign Minister Dinesh Gunawardena, has facilitated the repatriation of over 6000 Sri Lankan migrant workers and other citizens affected by the Covid-19 pandemic. The ongoing efforts aim to ensure the safe return of those impacted by the crisis.

Title: President Gotabaya Rajapaksa Virtually Addresses the Opening Plenary Session of the BOAO Forum for Asia Annual Conference 2021
Summary: President Gotabaya Rajapaksa addressed the opening plenary session of the BOAO Forum for Asia Annual Conference 2021 virtually on April 20th in Bo’ao, Hainan Province, China. The theme for this year's Forum was "A New Development Paradigm, Sustainable Development in a Changing World.

Title: Newly appointed Permanent Representative of Sri Lanka, Ambassador C. A. Chaminda I. Colonne reassured Sri Lanka’s commitment to the UNESCAP
Summary: Ambassador C. A. Chaminda I. Colonne, the newly appointed Permanent Representative of Sri Lanka to UNESCAP, reaffirmed Sri Lanka's dedication to the organization.

Title: Sri Lanka Ambassador to the Kingdom of the Netherlands, presents Letters of Credence to Majesty the King of the Netherlands
Summary: Sri Lanka's new Ambassador to the Kingdom of the Netherlands, Aruni Ranaraja, presented her credentials to King Willem-Alexander at the Royal Palace in The Hague on April 21, 2021. This formal ceremony solidified her official role as the ambassador representing Sri Lanka in the Netherlands.

Title: High Commissioner Srimal Wickremasinghe presents Credentials to the President of the Seychelles
Summary: High Commissioner Srimal Wickremasinghe presented Letters of Credence to the President of the Republic of Seychelles on April 20, 2021. The ceremony took place at the State House and was attended by the Minister o.

Title: Presentation of Credentials to the Director General of UNESCO by the Ambassador Prof.  Kshanika Hirimburegama
Summary: Ambassador Prof. Kshanika Hirimburegama presented her credentials to UNESCO Director General Audrey Azoulay at a ceremony in Paris on April 16, 2021. She assumed the role of Sri Lanka's Permanent Representative to UNESCO.

Title: Sri Lanka Business Networking Meeting in Brisbane
Summary: The Consulate General of Sri Lanka in Sydney, in collaboration with the Sri Lanka - Australia Chamber of Commerce (SLACC), hosted a business networking meeting in Brisbane. The event took place during an official visit by Consul General Mr. L, fostering connections and opportunities between Sri Lankan and Australian businesses.

Title: Turkey to enhance defence cooperation with Sri Lanka
Summary: Turkey and Sri Lanka are set to strengthen their defense cooperation following a meeting between Sri Lankan Ambassador M. Rizvi Hassen and Turkish Minister of National Defence Hulusi Akar in Ankara on April 14, 2021. The discussions were constructive and aimed at enhancing defense collaboration between the two countries.

Title: Ambassador Prof. Kshanika Hirimburegama presented Credentials to President of France Emmanuel Macron
Summary: Ambassador Prof. Kshanika Hirimburegama presented her credentials to President Emmanuel Macron on April 12, 2021, at the Elysee Palace in Paris. During the ceremony, President Macron encouraged all the Ambassadors in their diplomatic missions.

Title: Enhancing Cultural Cooperation: Interactive meeting with the Minister of Culture, Arts and Heritage of Maldives, Yumna Maumoon
Summary: High Commissioner Rohana Beddage held a virtual meeting with Maldives' Minister of Culture, Arts, and Heritage, Yumna Maumoon, to explore opportunities for strengthening cultural cooperation between Sri Lanka and Maldives. The discussion aimed to enhance collaboration in the cultural sector.

Title: SL community in US celebrates Sinhala and Tamil New Year through virtual event organized by the Embassy in Washington D.C.
Summary: The Sri Lankan community in the USA celebrated Sinhala and Tamil New Year through a virtual event organized by the Embassy of Sri Lanka in Washington D.C. The event brought together participants from across the country to mark the occasion.

Title: Sinhala and Tamil New Year celebrations in Paris
Summary: Sinhala and Tamil New Year celebrations took place at the Embassy of Sri Lanka in Paris on April 19, 2021. The event was hosted by Sri Lanka's Ambassador to France, Prof. Kshanika Hirimburegama, and featured various cultural activities and traditional rituals. It was a festive occasion bringing together the Sri Lankan community in Paris to mark the New Year.

Title: Sri Lanka Tea Board Participates at “Coffee Tea Cacao Russian Expo 2021” in Moscow
Summary: The Sri Lanka Tea Board participated in the 8th edition of the "Coffee, Tea, Cacao Russian Expo 2021" held in Moscow from March 11 to 13, 2021, at the Music Media Dome. The expo provided a platform for showcasing Sri Lanka's tea industry to Russian markets.

Title: Embassy celebrates Sinhala & Tamil New Year 2021
Summary: The Embassy celebrated the Sinhala & Tamil New Year 2021 at the Chancery premises, adhering to health guidelines set by Turkish authorities. The event was attended by Turkish government officials and Sri Lankans.

Title: Temasek Foundation of Singapore donates 300,000 Livinguard face masks to Sri Lanka Administrative Service Association (SASA)
Summary: Singapore's Temasek Foundation donated 300,000 Livinguard face masks to the Sri Lanka Administrative Service Association as part of their COVID-19 relief efforts. The masks were delivered to the association to support their initiatives in combating the pandemic.

Title: High Commissioner S. Amarasekara presents Credentials to President of South Africa Cyril Ramaphosa
Summary: High Commissioner S. Amarasekara presented his Letters of Credence to President Cyril Ramaphosa of South Africa on April 14, 2021, at the Sefako M Makgatho Presidential Guest House in Pretoria. This formal event signifies the official start of his diplomatic role in the country.

Title: Webinar on ‘German Sri Lankan Economic Relations:Maritime Industry and Digitalization Trends’
Summary: A webinar on ‘German Sri Lankan Economic Relations: Maritime Industry and Digitalization Trends’ was jointly organized by the Embassy of Sri Lanka in Germany and the German Chambers of Commerce and Industry (DIHK). The event aimed to explore the economic ties between the two countries in the maritime industry and digitalization trends.

Title: Investment and Tourism Event at the Sri Lanka Embassy, Beijing
Summary: The Sri Lanka Embassy in Beijing organized an investment and tourism event on April 14, 2021, coinciding with the National New Year celebration. The event aimed to celebrate Sri Lanka's Sinhala and Tamil New Year, fostering partnerships and promoting the country's investment and tourism opportunities.

Title: MoU signed between ICTA Sri Lanka and enpact e.V, Germany to collaborate between startup ecosystems and Webinar on AgriTech and WaterTech
Summary: The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Germany facilitated a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) signing between Sri Lanka's ICTA and Germany's enpact e.V. The collaboration aims to strengthen startup ecosystems, with a focus on AgriTech and WaterTech discussed in a webinar.

Title: Ambassador Dr. Palitha Kohona visits the Shaolin Temple in Dengfeng
Summary: Ambassador Dr. Palitha Kohona visited the Shaolin Temple in Dengfeng, Henan Province, where he was ceremonially received by the chief monk, Shi Yong Xin, and Deputy Chief Monk, Yan Pei. During his visit, he was treated to a specially prepared meal.

Title: Henan Province to Create a Sri Lanka Pavilion at the Giant  Bairong Wholesale Market
Summary: Henan Province plans to establish a Sri Lanka Pavilion at the Giant Bairong Wholesale Market. Ambassador Dr. Palitha Kohona met with Henan officials to discuss the initiative, receiving a warm reception. The Deputy Governor provided details on the current economic performance.

Title: B2B meeting to boost Sri Lankan exports of fruits and vegetables to Oman
Summary: The Sri Lanka Embassy in Oman, in collaboration with the Sri Lanka Export Development Board, facilitated a virtual B2B meeting between Carrefour Oman and eight leading Sri Lankan fruits and vegetables exporter companies. The aim was to enhance Sri Lankan exports of fruits and vegetables to Oman.

Title: Dr. Palitha Kohona presents Credentials to the Chinese President
Summary: Ambassador Dr. Palitha Kohona presented his Letters of Credence to Chinese President Xi Jinping on April 14, 2021, at the Great Hall of the People in Beijing. This formal ceremony marked the official beginning of his diplomatic duties in China.

Title: Special Representative of Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa visits Oman
Summary: Special Representative of Sri Lankan Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa, State Minister Ajith Nivard Cabraal, visited Oman from April 7 to 10, 2021. The visit aimed to strengthen bilateral relations between the two countries.

Title: Commonwealth Team wins Anton Muttukumaru Trophy 2021
Summary: The Commonwealth Team emerged victorious in the 2021 Anton Muttukumaru Trophy annual cricket match against the Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade (DFAT) and the High Commissions of Commonwealth countries in Canberra. The match was held in Canberra.

Title: Ambassador Dr. Palitha Kohona Meets with Senior Officials and NGOs in Shanghai
Summary: Ambassador Dr. Palitha Kohona visited Shanghai from March 30 to April 1, 2021, where he engaged with senior officials, NGOs, and leading business figures, including representatives from Zhejiang. Discussions centered around exploring investment opportunities and fostering collaboration.

Title: Ceylon Tea Demonstration and Tasting in South Africa
Summary: The Sri Lanka High Commission in South Africa, in partnership with the Sri Lanka Tea Board, hosted a "Ceylon Tea Demonstration & Tasting" event at Brooklyn Mall on March 27, 2021. The event featured leading Ceylon tea traders showcasing their products to the public.

Title: Minister of Energy participates at the 7th Berlin Energy Transition Dialogue
Summary: Sri Lankan Minister of Energy, Udaya Gammanpila, participated virtually in the 7th Berlin Energy Transition Dialogue on March 17, 2021. He was invited by Federal Foreign Minister Heiko Maas and Federal Minister of Economics and Energy Peter Altmaier. The event aimed to discuss global energy transition efforts.

Title: Novel Products enter Jordanian Market through the Facilitation of the Sri Lanka Embassy
Summary: The Sri Lanka Embassy in Jordan facilitated the entry of novel Super Food products like Avocado Powder and Pumpkin Flour for KETO products into the Jordanian market. This initiative is part of the Economic Diplomacy efforts to introduce new products to consumers in Jordan.

Title: Sri Lanka Embassy in Oman repatriates another group of 248 stranded Sri Lankan Migrant Workers back home
Summary: The Sri Lanka Embassy in Oman, in collaboration with the President's Secretariat and the Foreign Ministry of Sri Lanka, facilitated the repatriation of 248 stranded Sri Lankan migrant workers from Muscat. The special arrangements ensured their safe return home.

Title: The 5th Evacuation Flight from Lebanon 31 March 2021
Summary: On March 31, 2021, the Embassy of Sri Lanka in Lebanon, in partnership with the Presidential Secretariat, Foreign Ministry, and Sri Lankan Airlines, successfully repatriated 175 Sri Lankans, including 4 children, on the 5th evacuation flight from Lebanon.

Title: Building Bridges for Collaboration in the Business Sector: Interactive Meeting with the Chairman of the Philippines – Sri Lanka Business Council
Summary: Ambassador Shobini Gunasekera held an interactive meeting with Michael Chen, Chairman of the Philippines-Sri Lanka Business Council (PH-SLBC), and members of the Philippine Chamber of Commerce and Industry (PCCI) Board at her residence on the 12th. The meeting aimed to foster collaboration and strengthen ties between the business sectors of the Philippines and Sri Lanka.

Title: Ambassador Dr. Palitha Kohona visits Jinan, Shandong Province, March 21-22
Summary: Ambassador Dr. Palitha Kohona visited Jinan, Shandong Province on March 21-22 to accept a donation of 90 surgical mask making machines worth Yuan 17.74 million from the DMI Group. The donation was presented by the Chairman of DMI Group, Shi Qianping, and his team.

Title: Webinar held on Sri Lanka – Nepal – Business Environment and Opportunities for Collaborations
Summary: A webinar on the business environment and collaboration opportunities between Sri Lanka and Nepal was organized by the Sri Lanka Embassy in Nepal and the Ceylon Chamber of Commerce on 31 March 2021. The webinar aimed to showcase potential collaborations between the two countries.

Title: Consulate general of Sri Lanka celebrated the Maha Sivarathri in Saarland, Germany
Summary: The Consulate General of Sri Lanka in Frankfurt am Main, along with its staff, celebrated 'Maha Shivarathri' on March 20, 2021, at the Sri Mahamari Amman Kovil in Sulzbach, Saarland, Germany. The event marked a festive observance of the occasion in the Federal State of Saarland.

Title: Sri Lanka’s Envoy to the Kingdom of Sweden presents credentials
Summary: Ambassador Dharshana M. Perera has presented his credentials accrediting him as Sri Lanka’s Envoy to the Kingdom of Sweden to His Majesty King Carl XVI Gustaf. The submission was made through a special arrangement via the Protocol Department.

Title: The National Film Archive of India (NFAI) to archive best Sri Lankan Movies
Summary: The National Film Archive of India (NFAI) in Pune will archive the best Sri Lankan movies in their facility following discussions between Sri Lanka Consul General in Mumbai Chamari Rodrigo and NFAI officials. This initiative aims to preserve and promote Sri Lankan cinema for future generations.

Title: Establishment of Diplomatic Relations with Saint Kitts and Nevis
Summary: Sri Lanka and Saint Kitts and Nevis formally established diplomatic relations on March 22, 2021. The announcement was made jointly by the Foreign Ministry of Sri Lanka and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Saint Kitts and Nevis. This marks a significant step in enhancing bilateral ties between the two countries.

Title: Celebration of International Women’s Day
Summary: Consul General of Sri Lanka Madurika Joseph Weninger participated in a panel discussion on International Women’s Day alongside inspiring women, career Consuls General, students, and the Vice-President of the Goe. The event aimed to celebrate and empower women from diverse backgrounds and professions.

Title: The People’s Bank of China approves a 10 billion Yuan Currency Swap
Summary: The People’s Bank of China approved a 10 billion Yuan currency swap with Sri Lanka on 10/03. Sri Lanka Ambassador to China, Dr. Plalitha Kohona, welcomed the arrangement, stating that it is a welcome development.

Title: Ten-Year Remembrance of Great East Japan Earthquake
Summary: The Sri Lanka Embassy in Tokyo, along with the community, organized a special remembrance ceremony on 11 March 2021 to mark the ten-year anniversary of the Great East Japan Earthquake. The ceremony aimed to honor and bless the victims and survivors of the tragic event.

Title: 6th China-Sri Lanka Joint Workshop on Monsoon Climate and Marine Environmental Resources
Summary: The Consul General of Sri Lanka in Guangzhou, Priyangika Dharmasena, delivered a speech at the 6th China-Sri Lanka Joint Workshop on Monsoon Climate and Marine Environmental Resources, hosted by the China-Sri Lanka Joint Centre for Education and Research.

Title: Media Statement-The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Beijing , 13 March 2021
Summary: The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Beijing discovered the misuse of the Sri Lankan flag image on a "Non-Slip Doormat" made in China. Upon receiving this information, the Embassy promptly notified the Ministry of Foreign Affairs. The Embassy took immediate action to address the issue.

Title: High Commissioner S. Amarasekara meets several dignitaries in Pretoria
Summary: High Commissioner S. Amarasekara of Sri Lanka in South Africa recently met with various dignitaries representing the Diplomatic Corps in Pretoria, South Africa. The meetings were part of courtesy calls to strengthen diplomatic ties in the region.

Title: Ambassador Prof. M. D. Lamawansa presents Credentials to the President of Armenia
Summary: Ambassador Prof. M. D. Lamawansa officially began his role as Ambassador Extraordina by presenting his Letter of Credence to President Armen Sarkissian of Armenia on February 23, 2021.

Title: Ambassador Dr. Palitha Kohona Meets Vice Minister of Foreign Affairs Mr. Luo Zhaohui
Summary: Ambassador Dr. Palitha Kohona met with China's Vice Minister of Foreign Affairs, Mr. Luo Zhaohui, on March 3, 2021. Vice Minister Luo warmly welcomed the Ambassador and discussed matters related to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs.

Title: Sri Lanka – Oman ICT/BPM Sector Collaboration Mooted
Summary: The Sri Lanka Embassy in Oman, along with the Export Development Board, held a webinar on ICT/BPM sector collaboration with Knowledge Oasis Muscat. The event aimed to foster partnerships and opportunities between the two countries in the technology sector.

Title: Ambassador – designate to Thailand C.A. Chaminda I. Colonne presents open copy of the Letter of Credence
Summary: Ambassador-designate to Thailand C.A. Chaminda I. Colonne met with Director General Chittipat Tongprasroeth of the Department of Protocol at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs on March 3, 2021. During the meeting, he presented an open copy of his Letter of Credence.

Title: Consultations on the Seventh Biennial Review of the United Nations Global Counter-Terrorism Strategy
Summary: Consultations on the Seventh Biennial Review of the United Nations Global Counter-Terrorism Strategy were held with a statement by H.E. Mohan Peiris, Sri Lanka's Permanent Representative to the UN on March 5, 2021, at the General Assembly Hall, UNHQ. The discussions took place in person, addressing key issues related to counter-terrorism efforts.

Title: Ambassador Dr. Palitha Kohona hosts a luncheon meeting for the Ambassadors of Bahrain, Bangladesh, Indonesia, Maldives and Nepal to china
Summary: Ambassador Dr. Palitha Kohona hosted a luncheon meeting for the Ambassadors of Bahrain, Bangladesh, Indonesia, Maldives, and Nepal to China on March 1, 2021. Former Chinese Ambassador Sha Zukang also attended the meeting.

Title: Newly appointed Sri Lanka Ambassador to the Kingdom of Thailand C.A. Chaminda I. Colonne assumes duties
Summary: C.A. Chaminda I. Colonne, the newly appointed Sri Lanka Ambassador to Thailand, began his duties on March 1, 2021, at the Sri Lanka Embassy in Bangkok. The Embassy is concurrently accredited to the Kingdom of Thailand.

Title: Sri Lanka Embassy in Oman repatriates another group of 320 stranded Sri Lankan Migrant Workers back home
Summary: The Sri Lanka Embassy in Oman, in collaboration with the Presidential Secretariat and the Foreign Ministry, facilitated the repatriation of 320 stranded Sri Lankan migrant workers from Muscat. The special arrangements ensured their safe return home.

Title: Ambassador Kshanika Hirimburegama meets with Ambassador of India
Summary: Ambassador-designate of Sri Lanka to France, Prof. Kshanika Hirimburegama, met with Ambassador of India Jawed Ashraf on February 15, 2021, at the Embassy of India in Paris for a courtesy call. Ambassador Ashraf warmly welcomed her during the meeting.

Title: Sri Lanka discusses with U.S. Department of Justice charges against accused in Easter Sunday bombings and actions of pro-LTTE organizations on U.S. soil
Summary: Ambassador Ravinatha Aryasinha held a virtual discussion with Mr. Dan Stigall, Deputy Chief of Staff & Counselor for International Affairs at the U.S. Department of Justice, regarding charges against those accused in the Easter Sunday bombings in Sri Lanka and the activities of pro-LTTE organizations on U.S. soil. The meeting took place on February 17.

Title: Webinar on Business and Investment Opportunities in Sri Lanka
Summary: The Embassy of Sri Lanka, in collaboration with the Israel-Sri Lanka Chamber of Commerce and the Israel-Asia Chamber of Commerce, organized a webinar on Business and Investment Opportunities in Sri Lanka on 16 February 2021. The webinar aimed to highlight the potential for business and investment in Sri Lanka.

Title: B2B Meetings to Connect Sri Lankan Exporters of Avocado & Passion Fruit with High-End Supermarkets in Mumbai
Summary: Sri Lanka Consulate General in Mumbai, along with the Ceylon Chamber of Commerce (CCC), facilitated B2B meetings connecting Sri Lankan avocado and passion fruit exporters with high-end supermarkets in Mumbai. The initiative aimed to boost trade opportunities and promote the export of fresh fruits from Sri Lanka to Mumbai.

Title: Ambassador Prof. M.D. Lamawansa presents his letter of credence to the President of Moldova
Summary: Ambassador Prof. M.D. Lamawansa, representing Sri Lanka in Russia with additional accreditation to Moldova, presented his letter of credence to the President of Moldova.

Title: Message by Ambassador of  Sri Lanka to the Sultanate of Oman H.E. Omar Lebbe Ameer Ajwad  On The Commemoration of the 40th Anniversary of Diplomatic Relations between Sri Lanka and the Sultanate of Oman on 17 February 2021.
Summary: Today marks the 40th Anniversary of diplomatic relations between Sri Lanka and the Sultanate of Oman. To commemorate this milestone, Foreign Minister of Sri Lanka Hon. Dinesh Gunewardena and Fore will participate in the celebrations.

Title: 73rd Independence Day Celebration in Pretoria South Africa
Summary: The High Commission of Sri Lanka in Pretoria, South Africa organized a brief ceremony at the High Commissioner’s residence on 4 February 2021 to celebrate the 73rd anniversary of Sri Lanka's Independence. The event marked a significant milestone for the Sri Lankan community in South Africa.

Title: Celebration of 73rd Independence Day in Guangzhou, China
Summary: The Consulate General of Sri Lanka in Guangzhou celebrated Sri Lanka's 73rd Independence Day with the local Sri Lankan community, including businessmen who gathered with Consul General Priyangika Dharm. The event marked a significant occasion for Sri Lankans residing in Guangzhou, China.

Title: 73rd Independence Day celebrations in Tokyo
Summary: The Embassy in Tokyo organized the 73rd Independence Day celebrations virtually to adhere to COVID guidelines in Japan. The event utilized Zoom and Facebook technologies to accommodate a large number of participants.

Title: Sri Lanka High Commission Singapore celebrates the 73rd Independence Day celebrations with a virtual event
Summary: The Sri Lanka High Commission in Singapore marked the 73rd Independence Day with a virtual event on Zoom, attended by around 200 participants. The event's Guest of Honour was the Minister of State.

Title: Embassy of Sri Lanka in Germany Celebrates the 73rd Anniversary of Independence of Sri Lanka
Summary: The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Berlin marked the 73rd Anniversary of Sri Lanka's Independence on February 4, 2021, with the presence of Honorary Consuls from Germany. The celebration took place at the Embassy premises.

Title: Consulate General of Sri Lanka in Los Angeles, California, Celebrated 73rd Anniversary of Independence of Sri Lanka virtually
Summary: The Consulate General of Sri Lanka in Los Angeles, California, celebrated the 73rd Anniversary of Sri Lanka's Independence virtually on February 4, 2021, with the participation of the Sri Lankan community in California. The event was held online due to the ongoing pandemic restrictions, allowing for a meaningful celebration despite the challenges.

Title: Embassy celebrated 73rd Anniversary of Independence
Summary: The Embassy celebrated the 73rd anniversary of independence at the Chancery premises, adhering to health guidelines. The event was attended by a limited number of Sri Lankans and Turkish media friends, and included religious observances.

Title: Sri Lanka High Commission in Canada celebrates Independence Day
Summary: The Sri Lanka High Commission in Ottawa, Canada celebrated Sri Lanka's 73rd Independence Day on February 4, 2021, at the Official Residence of the High Commissioner. The event marked a significant milestone in Sri Lanka-Canada relations.

Title: Embassy in Washington Dc celebrates Independence Day
Summary: The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Washington D.C. celebrated the 73rd Anniversary of Independence with Ambassador Aryasinha announcing the launch of the 'Pan-US Overseas Sri Lankans Network' on February 4.

Title: 73rd National Day celebrated at the Embassy of Sri Lanka in Moscow
Summary: The 73rd National Day was celebrated at the Embassy of Sri Lanka in Moscow on February 4, 2021, with a live event due to limited in-person attendance. The celebration took place at the Embassy Premises in a fitting manner, marking the occasion despite restrictions.

Title: Sri Lanka’s 73 years Independence Celebrations in Paris
Summary: The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Paris marked the 73rd Anniversary of Sri Lanka's Independence on February 4, 2021, at the Embassy Premises. The event began with the hoisting of the national flag, celebrating the occasion.

Title: 73rd Independence Day Ceremony in the Embassy of Sri Lanka, Warsaw
Summary: The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Warsaw marked the 73rd Anniversary of Independence on February 4, 2021, with a ceremony held at the Embassy premises. The event was attended exclusively by Embassy staff in compliance with health regulations.

Title: 73rd Independence Day of Sri Lanka celebrated in Manila
Summary: The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Manila marked the 73rd anniversary of Sri Lanka’s independence with a solemn ceremony, adhering to health protocols set by the Government of the Philippines. The event celebrated the occasion in a respectful manner, acknowledging the significance of the milestone.

Title: The 73rd Anniversary of Sri Lanka’s Independence celebrated in Frankfurt
Summary: The 73rd Anniversary of Sri Lanka’s Independence was celebrated at the Consulate General of Sri Lanka in Frankfurt on February 4, 2021. The event was held despite the current lockdown in Germany, with limited participation.

Title: Sri Lanka Embassy in Ethiopia commemorates 73rd  Anniversary of Independence
Summary: The Sri Lanka Embassy in Ethiopia celebrated the 73rd Anniversary of Sri Lanka's independence with a reception at the Hyatt Regency in Addis Ababa on February 4, 2021. The event was well-attended.

Title: Seventy Third Anniversary of Sri Lanka’s Independence celebrated in Melbourne with online live streaming
Summary: The Consulate General of Sri Lanka in Melbourne, along with the Sri Lankan community in Victoria, South Australia, and Tasmania, celebrated the 73rd Anniversary of Sri Lanka’s Independence by hoisting the Sri Lankan flag. The event was live-streamed online for wider participation and engagement.

Title: 73rd Anniversary of Independence of Sri Lanka celebrated in Bangkok
Summary: The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Bangkok celebrated the 73rd Anniversary of Independence with a ceremony on 4 February 2021. The event took place at the Embassy premises and was attended by members of the Sri Lankan community.

Title: Sri Lanka Deputy High Commission in Chennai celebrates  the 73rd Anniversary of the Independence Day
Summary: The Sri Lanka Deputy High Commission in Chennai celebrated the 73rd Anniversary of Sri Lanka's Independence on February 4, 2021. Due to Covid-19 restrictions, the Mission was unable to host a formal event.

Title: High Commission of Sri Lanka in Canberra celebrates the 73 rd Anniversary of Independence Day of Sri Lanka
Summary: The High Commission of Sri Lanka in Canberra celebrated the 73rd Anniversary of Sri Lanka's Independence Day with a formal flag hoisting ceremony on February 4, 2021. The event took place outdoors on the High Commission premises.

Title: 73rd National Independence Day Celebrations of Sri Lanka in Malaysia
Summary: The Sri Lanka High Commission in Malaysia marked the 73rd Anniversary of Sri Lanka’s Independence on February 4, 2021. The celebration took place at the High Commission with the Mission Staff in attendance, adhering to the prevailing Movement Control Order (MCO).

Title: 73rd Independence Day of Sri Lanka celebrated at the  High Commission of Sri Lanka in Dhaka
Summary: The 73rd Independence Day of Sri Lanka was celebrated at the High Commission of Sri Lanka in Dhaka, Bangladesh on 04 February 2021. The event at the High Commission premises commenced with a ceremony.

Title: Sri Lanka Embassy in Brussels Celebrates Independence  Day of Sri Lanka
Summary: The Sri Lanka Embassy in Brussels celebrated the 73rd Anniversary of Sri Lanka's Independence Day on 4 February 2021. The national flag hoisting ceremony took place at the Sri Lanka Residence with the participation of embassy officials and guests.

Title: High Commission of Sri Lanka celebrates 73rd Anniversary of Independence in Singapore
Summary: The High Commission of Sri Lanka in Singapore marked the 73rd Anniversary of Sri Lanka's Independence on February 4, 2021, at its premises. The ceremony was held in compliance with COVID-19 pandemic restrictions.

Title: Embassy of Sri Lanka in Doha celebrates the 73rd Independence Day of Sri Lanka
Summary: The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Doha celebrated the 73rd Independence Day of Sri Lanka on February 4, 2021, at the Chancery premises. The National Day events began with the hoisting of the national flag by the Embassy staff.

Title: Celebration of 73rd Independence Day of Sri Lanka in Oman
Summary: The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Oman organized a simple ceremony to celebrate the 73rd Anniversary of Independence at the Embassy premises in Muscat on February 4, 2021, adhering to COVID-19 restrictions. The event marked the occasion with a ceremony to honor Sri Lanka's Independence Day.

Title: Sri Lanka Embassy in Beijing celebrates the 73rd Anniversary of Independence
Summary: The Sri Lanka Embassy in Beijing celebrated the 73rd Anniversary of Independence with Embassy staff, their families, and the Sri Lanka community in attendance. The event marked a significant milestone in honoring Sri Lanka's independence.

Title: Celebration of Sri Lanka’s 73rd Independence Day Anniversary in Sydney
Summary: The Consulate General of Sri Lanka in Sydney organized a formal event at the official residence of the Consul General to celebrate Sri Lanka’s 73rd National Day Anniversary on 4 February 2021. The program included various activities to mark the occasion and was attended by dignitaries and community members.

Title: Online meeting between Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka to the Russian Federation Meegahalande Durage Lamawansa and Chair of the Federation Council Committee on Foreign Affairs Konstantin Kosachev
Summary: Ambassador Meegahalande Durage Lamawansa of Sri Lanka and Chair Konstantin Kosachev of the Federation Council Committee on Foreign Affairs discussed the strong bilateral relationship with no major unresolved issues. Kosachev emphasized the significant common ground between the two countries.

Title: China national textile and Apparel Council signed the MOU with the Joint Apparel forum of Sri Lanka (JAAF) online
Summary: China National Textile and Apparel Council and the Joint Apparel Association Forum of Sri Lanka (JAAF) signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) online. The agreement was facilitated by the Embassy of Sri Lanka in Beijing, with Vice President Xu Yingxin representing China and Chairman A. Sukuma representing Sri Lanka. This collaboration aims to strengthen ties and cooperation between the two textile and apparel industries.

Title: Ambassador Malraj de Silva Presents Credentials to the United Arab Emirates
Summary: Ambassador Malraj de Silva presented his Letters of Credence to Vice President and Prime Minister of the United Arab Emirates, Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum, at the Qasr Al Watan Presidential Palace in Dubai. This formal presentation signifies the official start of his diplomatic mission in the UAE.

Title: The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Washington D.C. celebrates Thai Pongal
Summary: The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Washington D.C. celebrated Thai Pongal on January 26, virtually connecting with the Tamil community in the USA and a representative group of the Overseas Sri Lanka Community in the Greater Washington area. The event fostered cultural exchange and unity among participants.

Title: Ambassador-designate of Sri Lanka to Egypt assumed duties
Summary: The Ambassador-designate of Sri Lanka to Egypt, M.K Pathmanaathan, assumed duties on January 25, 2020. He was warmly received upon arrival at Cairo International Airport by a special representative.

Title: Sri Lanka High Commission in Singapore celebrates Thai Pongal
Summary: The Sri Lanka High Commission in Singapore celebrated Thai Pongal, a harvest festival widely observed by the Tamil community worldwide. The event highlighted the cultural and religious significance of Thai Pongal.

Title: Sri Lanka Embassy Jakarta organizes webinar on best practices in Indonesia in SME sector and cooperatives
Summary: The Sri Lanka Embassy in Jakarta hosted a webinar focusing on best practices in Indonesia's SME sector and cooperatives. The webinar facilitated discussions between the Ministry of Cooperative and Small and Medium Enterprises of Indonesia and the State Ministry of Cooperative Services, Marketing Development. The event aimed to promote knowledge sharing and collaboration in these sectors.

Title: Webinar on cooperation between ICT sectors of Sri Lanka and Viet Nam
Summary: The Embassy of Sri Lanka, in collaboration with the Export Development Board (EDB), hosted a virtual meeting on January 21, 2021, to discuss potential cooperation between the ICT sectors of Sri Lanka and Viet Nam. Representatives from both countries participated in exploring partnership opportunities in the field. This webinar aimed to strengthen ties and foster collaboration between the two nations in the ICT industry.

Title: Ambassador Prasanna Gamage meets with Officials of the  Foreign Trade University in Ha Noi
Summary: Ambassador Prasanna Gamage met with President Associate Professors Bui Anh Tuan, Vice President Pham Thu Huong, and other senior officials of the Foreign Trade University (FTU) in Ha Noi, Vietnam on January 22. The meeting aimed to discuss collaboration opportunities between Sri Lanka and the FTU.

Title: The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Russia commences work for the Year 2021
Summary: The staff of the Sri Lankan Embassy in Moscow officially began their work for 2021 with a special program on January 11, 2021. The ceremony was attended by Ambassador of Sri Lanka to Russia, Prof. M.D. Lamawansa.

Title: Thai Pongal day Celebration at the Embassy of Sri Lanka in Moscow
Summary: The Cultural Section of the Embassy of Sri Lanka in Moscow organized the Thai Pongal celebration on 14 January 2021, marking the harvest festival celebrated by the global Hindu community. The event highlighted traditional customs and cultural significance.

Title: “Sri Lanka opens its doors to the World” announced at the  Travel Trade Awareness Session in Mumbai
Summary: Sri Lanka announced its re-opening for international tourists starting from January 21, 2021, at the Travel Trade Awareness Session in Mumbai. The virtual session targeted the Travel Trade in Western India, marking the country's first step towards welcoming visitors from around the world.

Title: Ambassador-designate of Sri Lanka to the State of Qatar, presents open Copy of his Letter of Credence
Summary: Ambassador-designate M. Mafaz Mohideen of Sri Lanka presented an open copy of his Letter of Credence to Qatar's Minister of State for Foreign Affairs, Soltan bin Saad.

Title: Exploring Prospects for Bilateral Trade between SL and the Philippines: Virtual Interaction between the State Trading Corporation of Sri Lanka (STC) and the Philippine International Trading Corporation (PITC)
Summary: The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Manila organized a virtual introductory meeting on January 13, 2021, between the State Trading Corporation of Sri Lanka (STC) and the Philippine International Trading Corporation (PITC) to explore prospects for bilateral trade. This interaction aimed to enhance trade relations between the two countries.

Title: Sri Lanka to market consumer products in supermarkets in Austria
Summary: Sri Lanka will showcase consumer products in Austrian supermarkets, thanks to MTC Exotic Supermarket's support. The Embassy secured shelf space in Vienna, creating new market opportunities for Sri Lankan products.

Title: Sri Lanka Embassy in Oman repatriates 568 stranded Sri Lankan  Migrant Workers back home
Summary: The Sri Lanka Embassy in Oman, in collaboration with the President's Secretariat and the Foreign Ministry of Sri Lanka, facilitated the repatriation of 568 stranded Sri Lankan migrant workers from Muscat. The special arrangements ensured their safe return home.

Title: Ambassador – designate of Sri Lanka to Qatar Mafaz Mohideen assumes duties in Doha
Summary: Ambassador-designate of Sri Lanka to Qatar, Mafaz Mohideen, officially started his duties at the Sri Lankan Embassy in Doha on January 17, 2021. The commencement was commemorated with a simple ceremony.

Title: High Commissioner Kananathan presents credentials to UN Office in Nairobi
Summary: High Commissioner of Sri Lanka to Kenya V. Kananathan presented his credentials to the United Nations Office in Nairobi, where he also serves as the Permanent Representative of Sri Lanka.

Title: Ambassador- designate of Sri Lanka to French Republic and Permanent Delegation of UNESCO assumed duties
Summary: Ambassador-designate of Sri Lanka to the French Republic and Permanent Delegation of UNESCO, Professor Kshanika Hirimburegama, assumed duties on January 8, 2021, in Paris. The Sri Lankan National Flag was hoisted by the Ambassador during the ceremony.

Title: Ambassador Prasanna Gamage meets with Vice President and General Director of Viet Nam Chamber of Commerce & Industry Vo Tan Thanh
Summary: Ambassador of Sri Lanka to Viet Nam, Prasanna Gamage, held a meeting with Vice President and General Director of Viet Nam Chamber of Commerce & Industry (VCCI), Vo Tan Thanh, at the VCCI Headquarters in Ho Chi Minh City (HCMC).

Title: Dr. Palitha T. B. Kohona presents copy of the credentials to the Director General of the Department of Protocol of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of China
Summary: Ambassador of Sri Lanka to China, Dr. Palitha T. B. Kohona, formally presented his credentials to Hong Lei, the Director General of the Department of Protocol at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of China. This gesture follows protocol and strengthens diplomatic relations between the two countries.

Title: The High Commissioner – designate to South Africa Sirisena Amarasekara Meets the Honorary Consuls in Five Neighboring Countries
Summary: The High Commissioner-designate of Sri Lanka to South Africa, Sirisena Amarasekara, held a virtual meeting with Honorary Consuls from five neighboring countries on December 10, 2020. The meeting was organized by the High Commission of Sri Lanka in Pretoria to discuss diplomatic matters and strengthen ties in the region.

Title: Ambassador Dr. Palitha T.B. Kohona Visits Great Wall Industry Corporation
Summary: Ambassador of Sri Lanka Dr. Palitha T.B. Kohona visited China's Great Wall Industry Corporation on January 5, 2021, at the invitation of the Corporation's President, Guo Zhaoping. During the visit, the Sri Lankan delegation engaged in productive discussions.

Title: Sri Lankan envoys to South India meet with industry professionals to seek business opportunities for bolstering the economy
Summary: Sri Lankan envoys to South India held a business interaction session with industry professionals in Chennai to explore business opportunities for boosting the economy. The session included professionals from legal, film, and investment sectors.

Title: Sri Lanka’s boat manufacturing capabilities highlighted in Jordan
Summary: Sri Lanka's boat manufacturing capabilities were highlighted in Jordan during a virtual meeting organized by the Embassy of Sri Lanka in Jordan and the Sri Lanka Export Development Board on January 6, 2021. The meeting aimed to showcase Sri Lanka's highly specialized boat manufacturing expertise.

Title: Virtual meeting with the Officials of the Aviation and the Sri Lanka Tourism Promotion Bureau
Summary: Ambassador Dr. Nalin de Silva conducted a virtual meeting with officials from the Ministry of Tourism and Aviation and the Sri Lanka Tourism Promotion Bureau. The discussion focused on strategies to enhance tourism promotion between the two countries.

Title: Sri Lanka Ambassador-Designate to Japan assumed duties
Summary: Sri Lanka's Ambassador-Designate to Japan, Sanjiv Gunasekara, officially began his duties in Tokyo on January 6, 2021. He is the seventeenth Sri Lankan Ambassador to Japan in the countries' 69-year bilateral relations.

Title: Commencement of the First Working Day of the Year 2021
Summary: The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Beijing marked the first working day of 2021 by hoisting the national flag, singing the anthem, and observing a two-minute silence for national heroes. The ceremony honored those who sacrificed for the country.

Title: The Commencement of Work Year 2021 at the Embassy of Sri Lanka in Oslo
Summary: The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Oslo started its work for 2021 with a ceremony on January 4th. Ambassador Godfrey Cooray raised the National Flag and led the singing of the National Anthem. The event marked the beginning of the new work year at the embassy.

Title: Ceremonial Commencement of Work for the Year 2021 at the Consul General of Sri Lanka in Frankfurt
Summary: The Consulate General of Sri Lanka in Frankfurt held a special ceremony on January 4, 2021, to mark the start of the new work year, with staff participation. The program began with a ceremonial event.

Title: Commencement of Work in the Year 2021 at the Sri Lanka High Commission in Canberra
Summary: The staff of the Sri Lanka High Commission in Canberra started work for the year 2021 with a special program on January 1st. The program began with the hoisting of the national flag at the premises.

Title: Commencement of Work in the Year 2021
Summary: In 2021, work commenced with the hoisting of the National Flag, singing of the National Anthem, and lighting of the traditional oil lamp by High Commissioner Air Chief Marshal Ka. The event marked the beginning of the New Year with patriotic ceremonies and traditions.

Title: World Renowned Russian Gamaleya Research Institute of Epidemiology and Microbiology holds talks with the Sri Lankan Health Authorities and Experts on Sputnik V vaccine
Summary: The World Renowned Russian Gamaleya Research Institute of Epidemiology and Microbiology engaged in discussions with Sri Lankan Health Authorities and Experts regarding the Sputnik V vaccine. The online meeting was facilitated by the Embassy, connecting the Ministries of Health from both countries for the talks.

Title: Repatriation of Fourth Group of Sri Lankans from Lebanon on 21 December 2020
Summary: On December 21, 2020, the Embassy of Sri Lanka in Lebanon, along with the Presidential Secretariat, Foreign Ministry, and Sri Lankan Airlines, successfully repatriated a group of 271 Sri Lankans via a charter flight.
